I can't wait to come back for brunch, or the early bird wine pairing!

Took my mom here for her birthday and it was incredible. The polenta was delicious. I've had better pork chops though. I think because these were so thick the flavor couldn't be as abundant, but it was still very good. I can't wait to come back and try more of their foodThe ambience is really nice, very homey and romantic.Cheers!
Great place for brunch. Come early and make reservations for larger parties more than 2. Try the crispy eggs, eggs Benedict w salmon, and the French toast. Bellini and mimosa is a must

Went here for our 6 year wedding anniversary and we were not disappointed. The restaurant has such an amazing charm to it that I feel like I am transported to a different era. Cozy and romantic but also good for dinner or drinks with friends. Our server ( can't recall her name) was wonderful in making suggestions for our entire night. We started with the tomato and mozzarella and octopus as an appetizer. Both were excellent, the octopus was a little tougher than I prefer but still wonderful. For dinner I got the lamb chops and my husband got the Bronzino. They both were delicious. For dessert we got the key lime pie and apple strudel. Overall we were impressed with the service and food and would return! THank you for making our anniversary special !!

Amanda's is your standard weekend brunch spot--the menu is limited but the essentials are all there (omelets, Eggs Benedict, club sandwich, and mimosas :-p mmm)My only tip would be to skip on the fresh fruit plate. It's nothing special, just cantaloupe, honeydew, pineapples and strawberries. For 7$ it's not worth it, especially since the same fruit is served along side your entree.

Just finished breakfast here. We ordered the salmon eggs Benedict and the steak and eggs. The salmon eggs Benedict was not good - way overly salted, the eggs were overcooked and were not runny, and the English muffin was burnt. The steak and eggs was ok. We ordered the steak medium and it came out well done. The over medium eggs came out correctly and were as expected. The atmosphere? Uncomfortably pretentious and fake. The host wouldn't even greet us at the door, but talked to us across the dining room amidst other customers. It's a shame the food did not live up to other reviews or its own pretentious attitude. The service is what saved this place from getting a 1 star review. Our waitress was solid - attentive, courteous, but not overwhelming. Also the other help kept our drinks filled whenever they were half empty. Unfortunately, the best part of breakfast was the cappuccino. We will not be coming back when we would rather have breakfast at iHop for half the price while food quality and taste are what you can expect.

We go to Amanda's once a week when we are home. They owners, staff, and food is A+!I am a pescetarian so just can vouch on the non she'll fish dishes. I have tried them all and all delicious!This is a neighborhood gem!

Follow the laws of Boojie to have a good meal here.the place has an immediate boojie vibe, so if thats your thing you will be happy. My girlfriend and I had our valentine's day brunch here because, well, that's what you do on valentine's day (boojie things). To properly follow boojie law one must order boojie items, you will be rewarded for doing so. Drinks: I got a bloody mary, it was a small glass and not very good. My girl got a boojie bellini, it was good.Food: the brunch menu was nice and succinct. My girl ordered the boojie croissant french toast, it was delicious.  I ordered a ham and swiss omelet,  it was not bad but entirely flavorless. To be fair the non boojie bacon side was very good...  but it was boojiely priced!I think the takeaway is if you follow the principles of being boojie, you will enjoy your meal!

Not ecstatic that my first time here was for a price-fix menu however, that doesn't undermine the quality of the food and service we received. The dim lighting might have been a bit excessive but I understand trying to set the mood for Valentine's Day. All the food was great, and I especially loved when they poured the broth to my clam chowder table side - classy. All the fishes were cooked perfectly and the sauces were on point. The shortcake in my dessert however, didn't seem fresh; it was rather hard to cut into. Overall it was delicious but I feel, it was also a little over priced. I think we could have had the same quality menu for $20/15 a person cheaper. Still a Hoboken top-5 and must-try if you're only around for a couple of days. I definitely will be going back for brunch and to choose from the full range of the dinner menu.

Keeping it classy with the folks for Easter, we had our Easter dinner here one day early to avoid the crowds on Easter, plus the early dinner three course $16 prix-fix is available on Saturday.  The restaurant got very busy around 5:30 and service was friendly, but not warm.  Food was very good, had the cauliflower soup to start which was amazing.  I also tasted the polenta appetizer (Creamy Polenta with Red Pepper Coulis, Fresh Basil and Three Cheese Sauce) which was a big portion and delicious.  For mains I had the pasta special (Penne with Cherry Tomatoes, Asparagus, Wilted Greens and Herbs).   The asparagus in the pasta was well done, the sauce was light, but the penne was nothing special.  I sampled the Cod (Roasted Cod with Fennel, Fingerling Potatoes and Provençal Tomato Sauce) and I thought it was the better dish.  For desert I had the Apple-Raisin Strudel, which was 100% the bomb. Fresh apples were amazing, good strudel, and a balanced amount of cinnamon.  I would give Amanda's 4  1/2 stars for food, but the value of the early dinner special is outstanding, so 5 stars.
I went here for the first time with my friends. We loved their brunch options.  I liked their eggs Benedict a lot. Definitely will be back again

I took my wife here for brunch, and the food was delicious! I really enjoyed the atmosphere of Amanda's. I felt as if we were in an upscale restaurant during the Victorian era. We will definitely be going back!
Great food, great ambiance, and perfect for a romantic dinner.A bit pricy, but worth it!

This is a nice place.  The brunch is a must, but I am not here to discuss brunch.  The atmosphere is delightful, I feel like I walked into a fabulous garden party.  The place makes me think of Laura Ashley bed linens, all flowers and airy, but casual.  Very romantic, all I was missing was a croquette mallet.  This place is NOT pretentious and everyone is so nice!!! I went with a friend to sample their early bird pre-fixe menu.  It is the BEST DEAL EVER!!!.  Meal for two, 2 courses $32.00 ($16 per person) - 2 seatings - 5:00 and 5:30 (only).  You can also get a bottle of wine for $20!!!  It is totally worth it!  the menu is limited but you do get some good choices.  I chose Lobster bisque and Hanger steak (comes with brussel sprouts and roasted potatoes), my friend had Baby greens salad (with goat cheese and Balsamic vinaigrette and raisins) and Roasted Cod with fennel, fingerling potatoes and Provencal Tomato Sauce.  For dessert I chose key lime pie,  Everything was lovely - the soup was creamy and delicious (I do wish there were some chunks of lobster in there, though), the salad was fresh and not overdressed.  The Cod was excellent (I think I actually preferred it to my steak) and the steak was very good and cooked perfectly and came already sliced.  We did end up getting a bottle of wine and it was pretty good.  This is the best kept secret in Hoboken!If you have the capability to get there for a 5:30 seating DO IT!!!Will definitely be back
Such a great spot for lunch wonderful location. The service was amazing the waiters/waitresses were very attentive! The food was great defiantly will come back

Everyone raves about this place for brunch, literally you can't talk to anyone who has lived in Hoboken and not hear them mention this place.  They also state that if you want to get in for brunch then you better make a reservation.  We decided to buck the trend and try this spot for dinner.  Walking in I was immediately excited because the place was clean, busy, old school decorated, and not that noisy based on the amount of people that were dining.  We were seated immediately and our server took our drink order while we looked over the menu.  They have a full bar and pretty decent wine list, but we opted for cocktails which were mixed well.  They had some sort of large party going on so it seemed like servers were constantly running around.  No dinner specials, which I thought was bizzare but hey if your menu is that good then who needs specials.  We started with the muscles which the low point of the meal.  The broth was bland and lacked any distinct flavor.  The mussels themselves were a bit over done.  I'd skip them and try something else.  The entree's on the other hand were excellent.  My chicken was cooked perfectly and was very juicy.  My date loved the duck and just kept telling me how "this is how duck is supposed to be done."  The little presentation table side where they pour the sauce for you dish onto the plate was a nice touch.  The banana cake was a great finish.  The true test of service is if the water glass ever gets empty and this place passed with flying colors.

Amanda's continues to impress and should be considered one of the best date spots in Hoboken. Everything from the service, to the atmosphere to the technical execution in the kitchen is great. Our meal: beet/goat cheese salad & grilled octopus followed by seared duck breast served with couscous & pan fried monkfish with cannellini beans in a buerre blanc finished with an apple strudel and a caramel popcorn topped "panna cotta" (I dont remember what they called it)I'm not going to bore anyone with insane details. All the dishes were great and presented well, our server Mike (I think) was awesome and the setting is great. The front dining rooms are intimate and cozy and make for a great setting. Cons: the warm apple strudel came out cold and the meal isn't free! Hah. Pros: everything else.

Terrific! We went to Amandas for our second anniversary and instantly liked the place. The service was amazing and the chef was able to create a custom menu avoiding my wife's allergies. We ordered arugula salad, chicken breast and vegetarian pasta with select vegetables and a mixture of marinara and garlic sauce. Along with the server's recommended wine pairings, we had a wonderful dinner.

I really enjoyed my birthday dinner at Amanda's. The restaurant is cozy and very pretty: Iike you are eating in someone's home. They serve food on beautiful china of all different styles. The service is excellent - highly knowledgeable friendly and efficient. We went on a Saturday night (a good crowd) with five people and ate the following:- Bread was warm and fresh baked - yum!- Ordered excellent cocktails - the Smoke and Spice and a summer drink with gin and watermellon and my wife got a mocktail. The bartender prided herself on her mocktails and it showed with the fresh blackberry one that was made- They had featured wines for the night and we ordered an excellent New Zealand Pinot Noir reasonably priced at $35- Appetizers were solid - we had the Crab Cake, Beet Salad and Creamy Polenta. The polenta was the stand out with a sausage ragu on top and made perfectly- For mains I had the monkfish and my wife had the sole - they were good but not great. The monkfish was a little over cooked for me and both were a little bland. Other people in our party orders the Spicy Seafood Stew and got it a little extra spicy and LOVED it. I had quite a bit of it and it was addictingly good. The stew was enormous though and probably had a tad too many potatoes in addition to huge shrimps, clams, mussels and sole/salmon/monkfish so come hungry if you order it- We finished off with three deserts - the amazing cheesecake which has both ricotta and cream cheese, the butter popcorn creme de pot which I loved for the salt and savoryness and the light but lovely warm mixed berry tart. The cheese cake is brilliant and enough to share amongst three people. Oh and the coffee here is fantastic. We were stuffed and needed to be rolled out but the experience was absolutely satisfying. This was our first dinner out in Hoboken since moving from Brooklyn and it didn't disappoint. Oh and even though they gave me a candle and wrote happy birthday on my desert - they didn't sing which I greatly appreciated! :)

Dined her on a Saturday night and I was extremely impressed, mostly with the ambiance and décor. Loved walking in on a cold night to a room with a small bar and a wood fire burning. It was extremely cozy and welcoming. This place must be a home, converted into restaurant. There are about 4 rooms that make up the entire restaurant, and the basement level which is where the coat check is and where private parties are held. I heard that in the warm weather months, there is a back patio, not sure if seating is available there or not. When you are in Amanda's, it is hard to believe you are Hoboken. This is by far the best service I have received in Hoboken and the best crowd (older, sophisticated). For an appetizer, my boyfriend ordered the polenta and loved it. Fresh bread was served as well, which was very good. For dinner I ordered the grilled sirloin, I must say it was a little tough, but the red wine sauce gave it some much needed flavor. The presentation of my meal was great as well. There were a lot of little details that wowed me with this place, for example, each place setting has a different (decorated) plate. You can tell this restaurant pays close attention to detail. Everyone we interacted with, especially the hostess, were extremely friendly, accommodating, and polite. The only flaw I found about this restaurant is that there is 1 bartender for the entire restaurant. Yes 1. We came in first to have a drink and waited about 20 minutes before being served. Another side note that the menu is very small, but that isn't always a bad thing! So if you are looking for a classy dinner in Hoboken, this is your place to go!

Amanda's is a really cute, classy American place to dine in Hoboken- it's hard to compare to the city (where I recently moved from), but it's probably as close as gourmet gets in the 'boken (localites, please correct me if I'm wrong).  I totally loved the decor here- very cute, and townhouse-y.  Prices for brunch are on par as NY for the same dishes- poached eggs, etc. (lots of variations of this- the menu doesn't have a ton of variety, it's a lot of eggs, sandwiches, salads, etc) and well.. service wasn't really formal as the decor suggests. Which is ok; it's NJ. They were polite and prompt. Food:  My Dad ordered the soup of the day, a lobster bisque.  This had a weird sour ping to it.. and no lobster meat. Just lobster "essence," so it was not really chunky, the way I like it.  It was still creamy though. The presentation was it was nice (the way they present soup in formal places- herbs on the bottom; pouring in the soup). He followed up with the Turkey Club Sandwich, which I did not like, but I don't like cold cuts on sandwiches (I was actually a little disappointed it wasn't real turkey, but the cold cut)...the bacon was good though; it was extra smoked.  I always love avocado, but the bread and pesto mayo was whatever.  I also didn't love the shoestring potatoes- they were REALLY fried and more like chips versus fries. My Mom ordered the poaches eggs with crab hash. This was good... but wasn't really complex. It was a bit sweet and..cold? It was good though; the eggs were poached perfectly. Finally me. I thought I was ordered the most unique dish- the crispy eggs (poached eggs with panko crumb breading) with proscuitto, mixed greens, asparagus, and shitake mushrooms (these were a GREAT touch). It was yummy. We did not order dessert but some of the items looked good; I just had a coffee- nothing special. It wasn't too burnt.I would come back to try dinner.

Had such an amazing dinner tonight I need to review ASAP. We participated in the restaurant week menu and it was excellent. The decor was beautiful. Sexy and romantic. Restaurant is bigger than it looks from the outside. Had great service! I only have rave reviews and am so glad I tried Amanda's. I will definitely return!

I would venture to say that this is the best restaurant that I have ever been to in Hoboken. The restaurant has that old home feeling, like stepping back in time, or into a wealthy grandmother's home. The food is impeccable...need I say more? Our server was amazing and when the bartender/other staff were not busy they helped bus the tables and get us anything we needed. We were a group of seven, thinking we were a large group for the restaurant but they did a fantastic job at taking perfect care of us and making sure our wine glasses were always full and that we were enjoying ourselves, which of course we did!I had the pork chop which was very good, one of my friends had the duck, which I tried and it was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing.

Traveled here all the way from Central Jersey for a 5 star Valentine's Day meal tonight and was deeply disappointed.  Don't get me wrong the place had a nice decor, great customer service, and had a complimentary parking deck which was a nice walk away from the restaurant BUT if my belly ain't happy everything else doesn't matter. As an appetizer I ordered the strawberry crispy goat cheese salad with almonds, it was a small portion but definitely satisfying.  My husband ordered the octopus, potatoes, and arugala and loved it.  The meal started off very good. We both were thinking the meal can only get better from here... For my main course I ordered the sea bass and my husband ordered the petite filet. The sea bass had no flavor.  I could have made it better at my house.  My husband ordered the petite filet medium rare and it came out medium to medium well - and tasted like a plain steak. If I wanted a plain steak I could have ordered one at Outback Steakhouse that would have been seasoned with at least salt and pepper.The toffee chocolate dessert was delicious. BUT when I go out to spend big bucks...you expect to be FULL and love every bite, especially the bulk of the meal (AKA the main course).I am tiny girl with a big appetite. I would probably only come back here for dessert if I happen to be walking past the restaurant or I would try it again but not on Valentine's Day.

The food, ambiance and the service at Amanda's are all top notch!  I recently threw myself a fabulous birthday brunch here in one of their private rooms and the staff was extremely accommodating.  The food is excellent and the best I've found in all of Hoboken's one square mile!  Per the waitress' suggestion, I had the Crab Hash and it's going to take a lot of convincing for me to try something else next time I come here.  Friends of mine had the crispy eggs, the steak & eggs, the omelets, the salads, etc.  and everyone raved about it all.  Ooh, and we have not even discussed dessert!  Everyone loved the molten chocolate cake and I opted for a too good to be true ginger creme brulee.  Yum - happy birthday to ME!!It was my 2nd time at Amanda's (had previously eaten here during Hudson Restaurant Week) and surely my next visit will be soon!  I recommend it to everyone!

The best restaurant in the area. Elegant, service is perfect and all of the dishes the four of us ordered were prepared wonderfully. We were there the Saturday night before Mother's Day and it was filled to capacity, yet we sat down immediately for our 730 reservation. The only negative is parking, and we decided that since we live in edgewater, best will be to uber to the restaurant and back.

Came for brunch with friends and I had the creamy polenta with fruit and the crispy eggs. Totally delicious!! Mimosas were great too. That bread is amazing!! I'm still thinking about it. Will def come again :)

I want so badly to like this place as there are so many great reviews of it - am I eating at the same Amanda's as everyone else here?? I went for brunch today with a group of girlfriends. We had a reservation and were sat quickly and brought our coffee and drinks quickly - I had a mimosa and it was great, and a larger size than you usually see at brunch - it was also $7 - pretty good deal! I ordered the Poached Eggs with Crab Hash & Orange Hollandaise and got the hollandaise on the side. I found it to be completely bland. Even when I added the sauce, it was completely missing flavor. I tried a bite of my friend's dish, the Crispy Eggs with Asparagus, Shiitake Mushrooms, Prosciutto and Parmesan Fonduta. It was pretty good, although I found that to not have much flavor either. For dessert we shared the molten chocolate cake - it was the best part of the meal for me, although the "scoop" of vanilla ice cream it came with was barely enough for one person. Anyway, as bad as I feel about it, I continue to be completely underwhelmed by Amanda's.

Perfect Saturday brunch! Very cozy and warm place with nice decor. Food was great, steak was just as I loved it. The only downside is that it seems to be always very crowded. Only few tables for two, most tables for large groups and that's why it get very very loud in there. Despite all that, we will come back for sure!

It was very easy to get a reservation for brunch on a Saturday morning (I called about an hour before and arrived around noon). When we arrived, the place was not busy as I have seen it in other occasions however, for some reason our party of 5 felt very rushed and had to ask 3x for more coffee and water. When the manager approached us about whether or not we needed something, we let him know we'd ask a few times for a coffee and water refills with not luck and his response was "yes, we've been here... Will bring it right over" in a sort of condescending way. There were a few incidents of dishes breaking in the background...Overall poor experience... Fortunately our food tasted great! I will go back and recommend to friends. I just wanted like to bring this experience up to make the staff aware.

I have always wanted to try Amanda's as I pass it a lot and got to try it for the first time the other week. Before heading to a Christmas play I took my girlfriend for the early seated pre fix menu. It was a great meal and the wine deal made it that much better. The reason I will go back over and over is because of one main reason, the service. It is the best service I've experienced by far in Hoboken. They are very attentive and well trained.   The staff really wanted to make sure we had a very pleasurable meal and that made the whole experience for us. I can't stress how great our meal was because of it. Can't wait to go back!

Review of Brunch.  Sunday Morning.Somehow I had lived in Hoboken for four years without trying Amanda's.People really love this place... trying to not let the hype color my impression of the place.  Not a huge brunch person to begin with but I'm a fan of this place now.So we went, had a nice brunch and it dawned on me...While I enjoyed the whole experience and thought the food was good.  People love this place because it is so consistently above-average, category to category.  Each item, the service, the decor are better than just about everything else I've seen (in town at least) all for about the same price as a random bar's brunch.It wasn't the best brunch I've ever had, but it hits on all cylinders as good across the board.  Don't wait as long as I did to try this place - it is absolutely worth it!

Came here for brunch for my girlfriend's birthday. I had made the reservations on opentable and left a note saying it was for a birthday, and the day before they called me to ask me if I wanted to pre-order a dessert so that it would be a surprise at the end of the meal. I really thought that was going the extra mile in terms of service.The food was pretty unique as well. We had the crispy eggs, which are actually poached eggs that are then panko breaded and deep fried. Also had the poached eggs with crab meat hash. This dish was tasty, and surprisingly light. The restaurant is a bit more formal than your typical Hoboken brunch spot, so just know what you are going for.

Went to Amanda's for dinner for two this past weekend - as soon as I walked in the atmosphere had me floored. Amanda's look's like someones gorgeous, well-to-do built-in-the-1920s home, complete with roaring fireplace, family portraits and china cabinets, but not overdone. I also went at Christmastime and the place was decked out for the holiday while playing classic Christmas music over the sound system. I loved every second of it and couldn't stop looking around! On to the food - for apps we had the lamb meatballs which were great and had an amazing sauce. As an entree I had the duck with butternut squash, mustard greens and pancetta as a side which was wonderful, I also had a bite of the seared tuna entree and it was super flavorful. For dessert we shared a salted caramel pudding which is everything I want in a dessert - smooth and not too sweet, and I also loved the chocolate on the bottom which wasn't too overwhelming. I will definitely be back! Hopefully for brunch next time.

We were looking for a brunch spot, walking down the street, stumbled upon this amazing place. They have done a fabulous job by creating this restaurant.  Everything is just perfect and right! Service is wonderful, food is delicious although we've only tried brunch dishes, but no doubts everything else would be as good. Definitely coming back.

You can never go wrong with a dinner at Amanda's.I've been here plenty of times (the early bird pre-fix helps) and have always been satisfied.  Every dish is stellar, and their sommelier knows exactly which wines compliment the meals.  While I don't see a reason to deviate from the wine, they do have local brews on tap and a top shelf liquor selection.Realize however that Amandas can be pricey, and you may need a reservation.  Occasionally large events are booked and the restaurant will have limited seating.  Hence you should make a reservation every time.Undecided on what to eat?  Well you can never go wrong with steak!  Honestly everything is fantastic and you owe it to yourself to try Amanda's.

This is the second year in a row that I've gone to Amandas as an early Valentines dinner.  Both times the food, drinks, and service were incredible.Everyone from the bus boys to Amanda herself greets you as you walk in, and wishes you a good night and plenty of "hope you enjoyed your dinner" as you leave.The waiters are very very friendly, attentive, and professional.  The cocktails were delicious, appetizers portioned & timed perfectly, wine was affordable, and the dinner was outstanding.  Instead of desert we got desert cocktails which was perfect.Can't wait to go back and would highly recommend Amandas to anyone.

Ahhh Amanda's! I wish you were close to me. This is my favorite American restaurant in Hoboken. Everything is good in here. Their brunch menu is just delicious. Had the egg Benedict over crab cakes. Sooo good! I cannot wait to go back. For dessert we had the NUTELLA CHEESECAKE! Too die for! Terrific dessert! Can't wait to go back. Our waitress was so kind and very helpful. I Really admire how she works. I'm in the same business and she definitely owned that tip!
We come here ever Mother's Day, and the food is on point. The atmosphere is is welcoming. Highly recommend this for the next dinner outing.

Absolutely love it here! The food is amazing, the atmosphere is beautiful, and the service is impeccable. The servers and bartenders are very knowledgeable about wine. The early seating dinner menu cannot be beat - $17/pp for a three course meal and $20 bottles of wine. Highly recommend!

Yeah...it was as good as all the reviews said it would be. Stopped in for brunch this morning and we (party of 2 without reservations) were sat immediately. The steak and eggs with crispy home fries were delish.

Amanda's is great for a romantic dinner. It's a restaurant set In a historic style house, it's great.  They have delicious food and a pretty decent 3 course promotion during restaurant week.Perfect spot for breakfast or a brunch with the girls. I gave it four stars only because it's a bit costly. However, it is in Hoboken and it comes with the price of being there. It's located in Washington street, not far from many cool shops or the water front for a stroll along the NYC skyline.

Came here for a weekend brunch and the food was actually very good. The service was also descent. They were prompt and somewhat attentive. I had the Crispy Eggs with Asparagus, Shiitake Mushrooms, Prosciutto and Parmesan Fonduta which was very tasty. Never had "crispy" eggs before but was good. The decor is very warm and somewhat romantic. Now...why am I NOT giving this venue 5 stars...at no point did any of the staff "smile"...I mean at all. While they acted professionally, they looked miserable. Hopefully, this review will help the staff or management to smile more!

Amanda's isn't cheap, but it's pretty damn good for the price. Around $30 for a duck dish. Skin was crispy, a nice balance in seasoning. The salad was tasty as was the cous cous. Our server was such a pro. Someone at our table ordered a bottle of wine but wasn't aware he had to taste-test it. Our poor server stood waiting patiently, professionally, handling it very well. Would go again for a classy place in Hoboken.
Tried their Brunch. Good but NOT great..Crispy Egg is a must try !!!

This is more of 4 1/2 star rating, and not quite 5 stars, but since I can't give half stars I'm rounding up. Amanda's is a really awesome spot in Hoboken. Probably the most upscale dining in Hoboken besides Chucharamama and Fig Tree. It's very hard to give a full five stars because Hoboken only has a handful of places like this so I'm really just comparing them to each other. We came here on a Thurs night, and had an awesome private table. Our waiter was really nice and was very open with his suggestions on what to eat and drink. My fiance and I started with a few salads (beet and frizze). For entrees I had the pan roasted cod. It was a good portion size and had a ton of flavor. The fish was cooked to perfection and the accompaniments accented the dish well. My fiance had the short rib, which were braised in red wine and some other things I can't remember off the top of my head. It was excellent. For dessert they brought us a complimentary chocolate lava cake. I mean you can't go wrong with that, right?Amanda's def has their act together. Excellent atmosphere, not too expensive, great dinner and drink options and a staff that seams to enjoy working there. I'm def going back, and can't believe I've never been before.

Went for Brunch on a Sunday afternoon. It got pretty crowded but it was worth the wait. I had mimosas and the Salmon Eggs Benedict-SO GOOD! Prices were a little higher than average but the place is classy and cozy, and service was great.

Been here for brunch and dinner. I love both experiences.  The restaurant is very quaint like people have described. For brunch, I've had the eggs Benedict and they are pretty tasty.  For dinner I've had the lamb and omg it was soft, tasty. I probably order lamb in any restaurant that offers it and I must say:  Probably top 5 plates of lamb I have had in my life. Accompanied with polenta. Delicious, creamy. Can't eat here everyday though since it was pretty expensive and I'm just a measly nurse practitioner. Thank god for cousin engineers who take you out for dinner!?!!!!

Small, almost-romantic restaurant. I wasn't impressed with much of my experience, but I wasn't unhappy either. Just... meh. Service was spotty. Our server tried and was on top of most things, but he did have some errors here and there. Nothing major, just forgetting our desserts. The food came out at a slow pace. The interior decor is a bit outdated and unclassy. Food was decent, but I wouldn't return. I'm sure there are better places, at which to dine. My blueberry cake was more like a blueberry muffin, and I was severely under-impressed. I vaguely recall that my appetizer was my favorite, and the main was okay. They did write "Happy Anniversary" on our dessert plate, but unfortunately, it looked as if a kindergartner had written it. I wouldn't recommend Amanda's for a special occasion.

I am not a brunch person. Yes, I know that it negates all you ever thought about girls, but we do exist. That is why I never thought of going to Amanda's ,which seems to be well known for having the best brunch in Hoboken.I happened to go here for an early dinner with a book club I am part of. For $16 you get a first course, entree and a dessert. Its a good deal on its own but considering the prices at Amanda's at other times, its a steal.The place looks much smaller on the outside since it is so narrow, but once you enter you realize how long it is. It also has another level for what seems to be private events. The restaurant felt very comfortable, like being in a cozy apartment and the service was amazing from the get go.I was determined to have as healthy of a meal as possible so I started with the mixed baby greens salad that comes with balsamic vinaigrette, Sonoma goat cheese and golden raisins .I rarely order salads yet it was probably the most memorable part of my meal. It tasted very fresh and flavorful and had just the right mix of sweet and salty.For the main dish I ordered the pan seared chicken breast with sweet potato puree, sautéed braising greens, leeks, almonds, cranberries and natural jus. I was not really impressed by the chicken but everything besides that was great. For dessert I got the chocolate mousse which was just what I needed. It was simply decadent; soft and sweet just like it should be.I am not sure if I am going to be back for any other type of meal but I might have to leave work early one more time to take advantage of the early bird dinner and this time I am ordering the steak!

Jonathan is a total ass.  I was there for a baby shower brunch and he started hassling  the mother to be to move her gifts and could not wait 10 min for the car to pull up for use to u load them ourselves.  He had a terrible attitude and apparently was also a pain in the ass scheduling the venue with the hosts.

Came for brunch. They were busy and seemed a little disorganized. The food was okay...Not great for the price.My husband's coffee cup sat empty most of the meal - which is unacceptable for a $3 cup of coffee.I had a large piece of an avocado peel with the sticker still on it in my salad.I'm interested in trying it for lunch or dinner, but for brunch, I won't be back. A little pricey.

Came here for my birthday last year. We had a reservation but I don't think it was necessary since the place was practically empty (my birthday was on a Monday). We shared a bottle of wine, mushroom gnocchi for our appetizer (I think this was a special for the day), we both got the lobster bisque which was delicious. He got a steak and I got the scallops, which were slightly over-cooked but still good.  They surprised me with birthday dessert, creme brûlée  :)

I have lived in Hoboken for over 8 years and have always heard great things about Amanda's,  but never tried it.   I tried to once about a month or two ago,  and showed up 15 minutes before they opened.   I was annoyed that they wouldn't seat us,  but they directed my date and I to Elysian Cafe.   We made reservations this time on OpenTable. Com and showed up right on time.   There was a large group before us,  so we thought we would have to wait.   The host came right up to us and sat us immediately after we told him we had reservations.   The ambiance is amazing and is somewhat out of your great grandmother's house if you grew up rich,  which my date and I didn't,  so we were very impressed.   The table is pre-set with antique China that is decorated uniquely to each setting.   I love architecture and the ceilings,  walls,  and flooring are all eloquently furnished.   The bar,  which is to the immediate left as you walk in is a little small and could use a wider variety of beers,  could easily be used as a scene for Lucky Thomas in HBO's Boardwalk Empire. We were seated as a 3' x 3' table,  which is a little small.   This is an indicator or things to expect with Amanda's though.   I've learned over the years in Hoboken that expensive food never means better food,  so I was a little skeptical of the menu which generally runs about $30 a plate.   We asked if there were specials and I was surprised that there were none on a Friday night.  The waiter explained that they were in the middle of changing their menu though.   I ordered a beer,  muscles for an appetizer,  and the salmon dish.   My date ordered the chicken and a soda.   The waiter warned me that the salmon came with bacon,  which I was happy to hear,  but greatful for the warning.   The drinks were a little slow, and came out about 7 minutes after we ordered them.   I was slightly annoyed how long it took,  but the muscles came a few minutes later so that distracted my mind.   The muscles were amazing.   They were swimming in a lemon wine sauce that was a tad to salty for my taste to finish it,  but I still relished it on my bread.   The muscles came with bread that  was grilled and showed signs of the char lines.   This was a really nice touch that gave the dish a unique look to separate it from any presentation of muscles I have ever had.  The entrées came out shortly after we finished the muscles,  and that's when I realized the connection between the table size and portions.   The salmon was an inch wide by five inched.   It was a center cut,  so it was on the thicker end though.   It wasn't ornately garnished,  but looked very appealing if you didn't consider the portion size and the fact that you're 6'-2" and 240 lbs.   Luckily my date,  who has made it clear while writing this that she's my girlfriend,  is petite.   So,  I was happily looking forward to take her left overs and finishing them at the end of my date with a petite portion of salmon.   Her chicken was well dressed,  and was very appealing to the eye.   She fed me a piece like lady feeding the tramp, and it was mouth watering.   I never has chicken so moist before that wasn't swimming in grease.   Can I get that recipe? Please? The salmon was done to perfection.   It was pan seared and finished in the over to the perfect temperature.   Kudos to the chef!   The service was equally as good.   I would definitely recommend Adamda's to anyone who can afford a great tasting menu,  and who is not put off by the portion sizes.   I would recommend they give options for double meat portions with their meals,  and I will definitely go back.

Food is roughly 3 stars, but the service rounded the experience up to 4 stars. Jordan and the team were exceptional. We ordered at least a dozen dishes between us (10 people), but here are a few that I remember: - (A) Gnocchi - addictive - (B+) Risotto - (B) Mussels - simple, average, could be a good group option - (C+) Scallops were just ok - (A) Molten Cake was exceptionalI would recommend trying Amanda's if you find yourself in Hoboken.
Magnificent atmosphere, nice staff, ok food, and you must make a reservation. I ordered an omelet and my wife had the vegi Spanish potato dish. The serving of orange juice was too small.

We decided to try this place out after reading all the rave reviews on Yelp. We arrived without a reservation. Although you can make a reservation, we were told they accept walkins without one. We waited no more than 5 min before being seated. The hostess was very good and attentive. We ordered the polenta, which was REALLY good, perfect for a fall morning. The croissant French toast was rich and very good. I had the mushroom and vegetable omelet which was good--the hash browns as a side were crisp and seasoning just right. The fried egg dish--it wasn't horrible, but it was what one would expect. Perhaps the seasoning on the fried bread crumb topping could be seasoned better? Either way, I enjoyed the ambience of the place, drinks were good and I can't wait to come back for dinner.

Went to Amanda's for the third time last night.  Everything was so amazing that I had to write a review this time around.The first two visits to Amanda's were both very good.  Food, service, etc. - everything was on point.  Went there again last night for my girlfriend's birthday and couldn't be happier.  The food was absolutely outstanding.It's also good to note that we went during Hudson Restaurant Week.  $38 for an appetizer, entree and dessert.  In the back of my mind I figured the portions would be a little bit smaller than normal, boy was I wrong.  If you can go during HRW which happens twice a year, I highly suggest it.  It's truly a steal to get a meal for that price at this place.  Get a bottle of wine from their vast selection and you are good to go!Amanda's has now become a go-to place for me if I am looking for a more upscale type meal.  There are plenty of places in Hoboken to go to, but this is where you want to be.Looking forward to the next meal I have there.

Went here for brunch today with my gf. She got a Bloody Mary which I wasn't a big fan of because there was a lot of horseradish in it. I just got coffee, which I thought was great because it wasn't so hot that you need to let it sit for 10 minutes before drinking it.We got the polenta as an app, I wasn't that crazy about it but my gf loved it. We got the classic eggs Benedict and the pork tenderloin eggs Benedict. Both were great, definitely coming back to try more.
The food is DELICIOUS! Perfect.  Words cannot describe the food. Everything was on point. Customer Service was great! Love the inside. Its a very classy intimate place to have dinner.

I fell in love with this place. The customer service/wait staff was amazing. They were so attentive and polite! The decor is so cute and the it had a lovely atmosphere. Not to mention their food and dessert! The salmon and chocolate lava cake won me over. Definitely will want to come back soon.
Went here the first time for a baby shower and it was top notch! Ive also gone in for drinks and the bar area is a great space.
Love this place! If you want go somewhere for a romantic dinner with great service....this place is great. Beet salad, bronzino, scallops, lamb are some of the items I've had and they were all great.

What character this place has!  I felt like I was being welcomed into someone's home at the turn of the century...the 20th century, that is.  I was with a party of 7 for my father's 74th birthday and we were seated in our own small but private room!  Each place was set with a lovely and unique antique china dish.  I could see the working fireplace from my chair and I truly felt like I could sit and relax there all afternoon.We started with drinks.  My father and sister greatly enjoyed their not-too-spicy Bloody Marys and my Mimosa wasn't just fresh-squeezed orange juice with a splash of alcohol, but had a healthy amount of champagne.  Two large glasses on my empty stomach and I was definitely ready for some food!The seasonal soup of the day was a Butternut Squash Soup.  I was so surprised at how creamy it was even though there was no cream in it!  There was, however, a brilliant green swirl of chive oil that paired so well with the lightly sweet and nutty flavor of the squash.  My appetizer salad was a full plate of fresh mixed greens, warm chopped mushrooms, and creamy goat cheese.  I love when a salad is not overdressed and this one hit the mark.Moving onto our brunch entrees was a a real treat because I had never heard of "cripsy eggs" and had to try them.  I lie not when I say it was one of the most perfectly constructed bites I've had in my life!  The eggs are poached, coated in panko breadcrumbs, and then quickly deep-fried.  They are then served with hollandaise sauce and prosciutto.  The creamy yolks, the crispy breadcrumbs, the silky sauce, and the salty meat produced an amazing symphony of flavors and textures!Others in my family ordered the bacon (thick, smoky, and crispy) which came in a very generous 8-piece portion; the Croissant French Toast which was so buttery and decadent that you would not miss the warm maple syrup served with it; and the Eggs Benedict which, I'm told, were delicious.The only complaint of the day came from my husband.  He ordered the Grilled Skirt Steak and Eggs.  His steak was well-cooked, but not well-seasoned.  Table salt and freshly cracked pepper fixed things pretty quickly, but they shouldn't have been necessary.I really loved Amanda's and can't wait to go back!  I want to sit right near the fireplace next time!

Took my wife out on a date, visited Amanda's for the first time and WOW amazing.. Loved everything and so did she. We will definitely return back. Awesome chef at this place. Food, customer service, A+++

Decor:  This restaurant is for a very fancy occasion.  I would host and participate in etiquette dinners here.  Very well lit and classy. Employees:  Very kind and helpful.  They have great knowledge of alcohol pairing, wine pairing and cuisines.  Food:  The food was hands down delicious! Sometimes for early bird specials they have a three course meal.  Everything is always fresh and exquisitely prepared.  Prices: I have only been here for the early bird special and the price for 1 with a good bottle of wine is around $50.  This is a great place to bring a date and for a wow factor!

Brunch was awesome went on a Sunday. Love the decor and the food was amazing! Mimosa had fresh squeeze orange juice. I had the waitress give me her recommendation on what to order. I have the crispy egg with asparagus and shiitake mushrooms and greens and procuitto. I'm not a fan of a runny egg so the they made it we'll done. It was perfect for me. Will definitely be back very soon!
This place is all around great!-Food-Service & Management-Atmosphere-Cleanlinesslittle pricey but worth it.

I threw a surprise bridal shower brunch for my sister here on Saturday, August 31st.  The staff was extremely helpful and attentive throughout the entire 4.5 hours (we had the place from 11am~3:30pm) we were there.  We were a party of 12 in the Library Room.  I had spoken to Jonathan on the phone to plan out the event and coordinate menu items, etc and he was very polite, helpful and was always happy to give me suggestions when I couldn't make a decision.The day of the shower, the staff even helped me with balloons we had for decorations, and helped us carry things from my car into the restaurant.  The food and drinks were very good and no one ever had an empty glass or cup. The polenta from the weekend brunch menu was a hit!  Service was attentive, polite, professional...I have no complaints about this place!  The Library Room is super cute and I am very happy I went with Amanda's.  I will be recommending this place to all of my friends!!

Went here for brunch with my boyfriend today because Anthony David's was full. I really like the atmosphere of this place; it reminds me of a Victorian house, with its antique wooden hutches and cupboards, ornate ceiling decorations, and polished brass and wooden bar. Although we didn't have reservations, we were seated quickly and served promptly by an efficient, polite waiter. I ordered the cured salmon and spinach Benedict while my boyfriend ordered the ham and Swiss cheese omelette with a side order of fruit compote. I also had a mimosa with my meal. My Benedict was very good, and the poached egg was cooked just right. I also sampled my boyfriend's omelette, which was light and fluffy. My only complaint was the fruit compote: it was more like a variety of fruit piled onto a plate. It was good though. I'm sure we'll be back to see what else Amanda's had to offer.

The food was okay, but is it just a coincident that they segregated seating by race...? It was very questionable and was not pleasant. I observed that all colored skin people seat in the back and all whites in the front.

Just got back from Amanda's. I've been wanting to dine there for 2 years now after we cancelled a post Valentines dinner. The place is very charming and romantic.  We had the mussels in white wine and garlic sauce as well as the polenta with mushroom ragout and cheese sauce. Both were very good starters. Also, their wine list is pretty thorough. I had the cod entree which was served with chorizo and fingerling potatoes in a clam sauce. Pretty yummy. The cod was cooked perfectly. My lady had the pork chop with braised red cabbage, prunes, and mashed potatoes. I wish I woulda got that!!! Nice crust on the pork and tender and juicy on the inside. The server we had definitely made the entire experience that much more memorable/enjoyable. She was extremely pleasant and attentive. Definitely glad we came here. Well worth our wait. ENJOY!!!

I had the Steak Tartar to start. It was good with great flavor. For my entrée I had Smoked Duck Pastrami Carbonara. I wasn't really impressed with this dish. For dessert I had the Chocolate Toffee Bar. This dessert was great and the Raspberry Sorbet went perfect with the toffee bar. My husband had the Baby Spinach Salad to start which he enjoyed. For his entrée he had the Provençal Braised Chicken. The chicken was cooked perfect but the flavors were a little bland. For dessert he had the Almond Pound Cake which was delicious. The ambiance is a little dated and the tables are quite small but the service was great.

Amanda's is wonderful.  The food is exceptional, the staff is professional and the ambiance is beautiful and makes you feel like you are having a meal in your own dining room.  My family and I have enjoyed many meals here.  We often come here for special occasions such as Christmas or Easter.  On one occasion my family got a private room to itself for brunch. I strongly recommend Amanda's.

I'm giving this a 3 only because of the pricing and hype surrounding the restaurant. We went for Hudson restaurant week last fall. The food was delicious; however, when compared to similar priced restaurants in the area, I was hoping for a bit more innovative menu and "wow" factor. Overall a great meal.

Brunch- 4.5 stars Dinner 2.5 starsTied with Elysian for my fave brunch in Boken. Reasonably priced for it's elegant surroundings and soothing jazz playing in the background.  The closest you can get to a womb-like environment to recuperate from a night out.Dinner however has been disappointing. Overpriced and you can get better, more creative food elsewhere.

We went there for Sunday brunch with another couple and our two 5 month olds.  The staff was extremely accommodating even though it was very busy.  The well dressed staff continued to be attentive throughout the entire brunch.  The atmosphere in Amanda's is unlike any other place in Hoboken because of its elegant fine dining mixed with that boutique feel of an old Hoboken brunch. The food was absolutely delicious and all four dishes came out flawless. Amanda's has nailed it.

I don't know how I have not added a review for this before now. My wife and I make it a point to come here every time we are in the NYC area. In my opinion, this is not only the best restaurant in Hoboken, but in the entire NYC area. The food is fresh, amazingly balanced and always innovative. It is also extremely good value. The steak, blue potatoes and green beans are just amazing!Also, the inside of Amanda's is stunning.

Beautiful restaurant from which you would never guess from the outside.  Great service, definitely more upscale, great food.  I had the short rib hash and poached eggs and my daughter had the steak and eggs..delectable.  Try it you won't be disappointed

This place is adorable. My boyfriend took me here for a romantic date night and I was oh-so pleased. They first serve yummy warm bread rolls, and cute little butter balls.I ordered the salmon over lentils which was cooked to perfection - cleaned my plate!We ended the meal with their chocolate molten lava cake you gottta try it! So gooey and delicious.Love this place.

Took my husband here for a Father's Day date night and we were really pleased with our experience. The staff was super professional. The restaurant was clean and a very relaxing atmosphere. It's very romantic in the back! I highly recommend it for a date night. The food was stunningly delicious. We will definitely be back! I recommend the duck or roasted chicken. They were both superb. As well as the molten chocolate cake. Enjoy!

You will be pampered; your taste buds will be delighted; your souls will be replenished...all for an affordable price of $16/person.This prix fixe menu is something of a godsend. I selected the mixed baby greens salad, the penne, and the key lime pie. All were excellent selections. The penne was the weakest part of my meal. It was delicious, but I'm not much of a pasta person, so my biggest complaint is that there is only one vegetarian entree on the fixed menu, which is really unfortunate when you dislike pasta. I also sampled my date's polenta, which was formed into a cute little cake with incredible sauces draped over it. He also got the apple raisin strudel for dessert, and I think that might have one-upped my key lime pie. It was warm, flaky, and just the right amount of sweet.I would absolute recommend this experience to a friend, especially if they were omnivorous.

This is THE brunch destination in Hoboken for a reason. Their brunch menu has so many amazing options, it's unbelievable. The croissant french toast is a really delicious and unique take on the usual french toast, and the whipped cream it's served with is also great. The bacon is super crisp. The mimosas were made perfectly.I happened to visit only a few hours after a major water main break knocked out running water to virtually all of Hoboken. While many restaurants unfortunately had to close, and lots of people on the streets were carrying take-out pizza home for an improvised lunch, Amanda's not only stayed open, they didn't miss a beat at all. The entire menu was still available, and they still served glasses of water to every table as usual. Since they couldn't wash any dishes, they were able to quickly improvise and use plastic utensils and plates (that were made to look like real silverware and plates!). The restaurant was still packed, the service was still excellent, and food was still delicious. Our waiter apologized to us after brunch for needing to use plastic silverware - not that he had any need to apologize - and said that they weren't going to let a water main break get in the way of their usual business.Kudos to the owners and staff at Amanda's for not missing a beat despite not having any running water, when so many other restaurants shut their doors for the day.
People are very nice. The bread you get on the side is delicious. Their smoked salmon is always fresh, and cheese cake is the best.

Amanda's used to be a great date night spot. Always great food and a formal, but not stuffy atmosphere. The atmosphere has stayed the same, but the food is just okay now. The mixed salad had nothing special to make it stand out. The blue cheese mashed potatos didn't taste of blue cheese and were bland because of that fact. It was all just okay, nothing special. Considering the decline in the quality of food coupled with the high prices, I would find some place else to go.

I have to give my first time here a simple and basic three star review. There were several unfortunate moments that overshadowed the spectacular food offered here. In celebrating our 13th wedding anniversary we took the advise of a few friends and made reservations at Amanda's. Upon entry after a brisk 4 1/2 block walk from the parking lot we walked in and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited some more for the host who without bothering to look up once and at the very least acknowledge our presence in the room had taken the time to converse with other patrons, and make three trips behind the main entry way a curtain to bring out three separate cocktails. When he was done serving all if this tables cocktails he finally looks up and offers his service. We are seated and our experience officially begins. It's a Sunday night in February at 6:45. Their first thing I order is the very first cocktail on the menu and I am told it is not available  fine so I order something else, the I ask if I could have the salad on their special restaurant week menu in a full size and I'd be happy to pay a full price and I'm told that it cannot be done. Fine so I doer something else. Then I order my main meal l and guess what - not available, ok how about .... And again I am told no not available. At this point I would prefer to just go home but for my spouses sake and the face that we did drive in and the car was almost five blocks away I kept my smile on and adjusted. To the chefs benefit, the food did end up being DELISH and the cheesecake was WOW (pineapple upside down - not so much) but the overall service - except for the guy who kept filling our water, was mediocre at best. I wouldn't return, there are  plenty of places to find divine food and better service at the same price.

I sort of have a hard time liking Amanda's. I've been there twice, both times for brunch - most recently this morning. Here's the main thing to know: this is DEFINITELY a brunch menu, bordering more on breakfast. If you tend to be more of a lunchy-brunch person, you're not going to love it. I think my problem is that I'm more of a lunch person... Pancakes and French toast are not appealing to me. I like eggs, but I always feel stupid paying more than diner prices for eggs.... Seriously: Why would eggs, bacon and potatoes ever cost more than like $8 tops?! For that reason, I'm always disappointed with my meals at Amanda's. It's not because the food isn't tasty... It's just... So breakfasty. That all being said...My fiancé ordered the poached eggs with crab hash and loved it. I ordered the crispy eggs (poached egg, coated in panko and deep fried) with shiitake mushrooms, asparagus and green salad, which was good, but incredibly rich (read: too much). My fiancé's father ordered the croissant French toast which he said was ridiculously decadent (read: delicious). I will give them a thumbs up for their Bloody Mary - that was super tasty. But my coffee was served cold, and we had to ask 3 times for more butter for the table. Like I said, I'm really torn - from a service standpoint it was great, but from a food standpoint, I just haven't been able to walk away happy or satisfied...

Visited this place for Sunday brunch.  Hoboken isn't normally a place I consider a destination, but couldn't resist after reading the reviews.  I was in a party of four, and everything each of us ordered was pretty splendid, quite fresh, and perfectly prepared.  Service was top notch, and the atmosphere was cozy and warm.  The Bloody Mary's alone made the trip worthwhile.

Tried this place today for the first time, even though I lived 2 blocks away from here for a few years. It wasn't until I moved out of Hoboken that I heard about how great this place was. Boy did I miss out!! I wish I had tried it much sooner. Cute and quaint inside, this adorable restaurant is very comfortable and accessible. The menu had a lot of variety, but isn't overwhelming. I met an old friend here for brunch and I ordered the crispy eggs. I am a sucker for poached eggs especially since no matter how many times I've tried, poaching eggs at home is a skill I have yet to master. The crispy eggs are poached, then deep fried and served over peeled asparagus, shiitake mushrooms and mixed greens with prosciutto on the side. There was a cream sauce on top as well. The saltiness of the meat and the sweetness of the cream sauce really played well with the eggs and the rest of the dish. It was really the perfect bite! For dessert I had a molten chocolate cake which was served with vanilla ice cream. Not much to say, as molten chocolate cake is always delicious. At the end of the day, I can't wait to find an excuse to go back and eat here again.

One of the most unique dining experiences in Hoboken by far. Sadly, I have only been here about three times but WOW. It is truly one of the most, if not THE most awesome dining experience I have had. What I love is how it doesn't strive to be trendy or "new" like other restaurants. It certainly has an old school charm transporting you to more of a Martha's Vineyard type scene vs. a glitzy metropolitan spot. There is a very well-stocked yet small bar as you walk in. What's great about it is it never gets packed at all as it serves as a waiting area. This is a very nice touch. If your date is running late or your table is being cleaned off you can order a drink here and then bring it to the table when everything is ready. The staff goes out of its way for you. Very friendly. The servers certainly are used to customers with high expectations and make sure your food and overall experience is five star. I believe I had a mushroom ravioli here that knocked my socks off. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but not out of the normal for such a fine establishment as this one. This is the quintessential place to go for a special date or occasion.

We had not eaten there for awhile so the place was fresh in ou r minds. After a drink at the bar,a well made martini and Cosmo, we seated  seated, hande menus and the server explained the specials. I ordered the pork belly special appetizerwhich was wonderful and  then the roasted monkfish in a carrot purée with endive and onions that was decisions.  My  wife had  had  the creamy polenta and then the filet mignon  which she loved. For dessert we had  the berry crisp with vanilla ice cream.  Everything was very good and portion size was excellent.We also ordered a bottle of wine, even with that the price of the meal was well worth it. Lastly the service was superb

Ever since a delicious Restaurant Week experience last year, I had been excited to take my bf here. Finally had a chance to come back and was sorely disappointed. Appetizer: steamed black mussels. While a generous portion, very mediocre. Mussels didn't aste fresh, and white wine garlic broth was bland. It's unheard of for me to leave mussels on the table but we just couldn't finish it. Entrees: BF's spicy seafood stew was not memorable at all. There was nothing wrong with it, but it just tasted like something any decent home cook could have prepared.My rack of lamb was ordered medium well, but the thing came out very bloody. Server had it re-fired quickly, but this shouldn't happen at this kind of place.While I was waiting for my entree to return, I had some time to check out the scene. There was a lady, maybe a manager, who went around greeting every table around us asking how their meals were, but not us...either they already knew I wouldn't have great things to say, or just didn't care to check on us. Sadly, will not be back.

amazing brunch! I had the cirspy egg with shiitake mushroom and it was nothing like I ever tasted. the egg is fried with batter and super crispty but it wasn't greasy or nauseating. it gets quite crowded but their food and service is great. can't speak for the lunch/dinner food but the brunch was quite delicious. the interior is a little tight but very cute and has a french feel.

I went here with dinner. My first though....What is up with the decor here? I felt like I was in my grandmom's old house. Definetley needs an update.For wine bar, this place is okay. The wine list is small, but the selection isn't bad - oenophile's will be able to find something to drink in every price point. They did have a rare Malbec from Argentina which was nice to see. As far as food, the food is okay.For appetizer, ordered spinach salad and polenta. The salad was nothing special but the polenta was awesome. In fact, the polenta was the highlight of the meal.  My dish matched the decor - tasted like something my grandmom will make. I ordered herb chicken - it had potatoes and some carrots on the side. This was not good at all - uninspiring and really bland. I ate like a girl here - which never happens.Amandas is okay for dinner. Maybe I need to try this place for brunch and ti will be a better experience.

Came for brunch after a night of drinking. Mostly because of the sun dried tomato infused vodka bloody mary's. And because my friend's name was Amanda. I felt like I was in a doll house... not in a bad way,  but it was interesting. Not as expensive as you would think, either.  The food was very yummy, though. I loved the place settings.

On yet another brunch outing with the boyfriend, this time we decided to fancy it up and try Amanda's down the road. It has a reputation for being delicious and for having a beautiful space with good service. They weren't wrong.Amanda's is in a big, old building with numerous rooms. The decor is classic and feels very homey. There was plenty of space which was good because it was very crowded. (Good thing we had reservations! Phew!) Our waitress was incredibly nice and even let us know that there's free parking! So for all of you drivers out there, you have a winner.I ordered the eggplant fritata. The rolls served beforehand were SO DELICIOUS. It wasn't even fair because I wanted a full basket of them. (Which they do offer as part of a large bread basket you can order. (It looked beautiful.)) When the fritata arrived, I tried it and was very satisfied: the eggs were cooked well, the veggies the correct ration of squishy to crunchy. If anything, it could have used cheese, but I enjoyed it.I also tried boyfriend's pumpkin soup and it was to die for. Although the price vs. serving size ratio is a bit off here, which is why I've downgraded to four. Otherwise, it's a fantastic brunch venue. You will see me here multiple times in the future.
friendly staff, great food.  the only issue I had was some of my greens in my salad were wilted.  But the food nonetheless is phenomenal!

I was here Sat. night for a special early group birthday dinner for a friend of a friend.  The management/servers were very accommodating since some people arrived late, and everyone was professional and polite.  The food was wonderful.  The early (5 or 5:30 seating) dinner is $16 for 3 courses.  I had polenta with basil and cheese sauce, penne with vegetables, and key lime pie.  Perfection.  I would definitely come back to this lovely restaurant.
Amanda's is a great place to go for brunch! Beatiful warm decor but can get crazy busy so definitely get there early! Omeletes are delicous and the mimosas are even better!

The food is good.  It's just a little fancy.  The china, white table cloths, and dinner rolls served with brunch are nice but not my go-to.  I usually like a place with more of a laid back casual vibe. And home fries. ;)The staff is very nice and the experience is nice, maybe for a special occasion or something. I fell like I can't go there in yoga pants and a pony tail for a regular brunch with my friends.
Their brunch is perfect. Menu is reasonably priced and the staff is amazing! It is a very quaint little place. Perfect for date night or brunch with friends.

We have been to here many times before, but last night dinner service is the first time I am writing a review on this place.   First of all the place has always been high quality and service in the past visits.  We had dinner reservations for 7:30pm for a party of four.  We did arrive on time and was seated by the host, whom we assumed was the manager.  The busboys did their stuff with the water and breads and then after a few minutes our waiter appeared .  We already had the menus from the host when we sat and were advised of their anniversary special dinner.    Our waiter came by and introduced himself and then we proceeded to order our Apps.  We had a question on one of the apps and the waiter did not know the answer and took off to find out.  Upon his return he did have the answer and we continued to order the apps and our main meal at this time. (Both together) Then we ordered the wine, two bottles, one white and one red.  Upon arrival of the red wine, it was the wrong selection we had told the waiter and that had to be returned.  The correct wine appeared.  We received our apps around 7:50pm and there were perfect .   We noticed the back room was full of guests and it seemed like a good part of the staff was working that area.   We ate the apps and continued to drink our wine.  As time passed we noted we had not received our food nor has our waiter come by to check on us for anything or advise us of a delay.  I attempted to make eye contact with our waiter in his passing, but he did not look our way.  Finally it was 8:50pm and our main meal has not arrived, I saw the Host (manager) and called him over to let him know our food has not arrived and he said he would check on it.   A few minutes later the waiter appeared and advised us it seemed the kitchen was backed up.  We assumed this due to the Large back dinner going and the rest of the place was generally busy. Or our main meal ticket was misplaced in the kitchen. The host (manager) did not come back to us to let us know the reason as I had asked him, he had send over the waiter to advise us.Our main meal finally came to us at 9pm, (came very fast once we advised the manager) with no apology for delay or any other words as to the foods being so late.  The meal was good, so we have no complaints on the foods, but only the service last night..  We also felt the Host (manager) should of offered us a glass of wine for a dessert on the house due to the long wait.  We did order dessert and were charged for it. I hope last night was  not what is normal for this place.

In between here, the food was better than average, our waiter was brilliant, but it was Super bowl night so quiet... We were informed it was Restaurant Week which was cool, I assume that since 2 of the 3 sides were unavailable, as were half the appetizers, and the best entrees they'd be flexible.. But  "no".. Order from one side or other! Disappointing to be honest...but the food we were "allowed" to choose was very  tasty.

Amanda's is the clear winner in one of the best restaurants in Hoboken. Not only is the food amazing, but the service is excellent as well.I've been here many times for dinner with my wife. We also enjoyed a beautiful brunch engagement party in a private room, which was fantastically done. All of the food was excellent, but their brunch is my favorite. Go for the steak and eggs.And parking is validated. In hoboken, that's awesome!And kudos to the Amanda's owners, for your generous reaction in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy. Well done!

By far my favorite brunch spot in Hoboken. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Food is always delicious!! I have never had a bad experience here. I would suggest making a reservation as it gets busy, but it's worth the wait if you just pop in! I always recommend Amanda's when friends ask for a restaurant recommendation.

My boyfriend and I went here for Valentine's Day and this place exceeded our expectations.The ambiance of the restaurant was great, it was very busy but not too noisy and there was a fireplace right when you walk in, which automatically sets the tone. We were immediately greeted by Amanda herself, who was extremely humble, friendly and professional. The meals were a little pricey and there was a pre-fixe menu for the holiday but everything we had was great. The chocolate toffee bar for dessert is incredible. The service was perfect and Amanda came by at the end of the meal to ask how everything was and to thank us for coming.Overall, we absolutely loved the food, service, and intimate ambiance. This is definitely our new "special occasion" restaurant.

Amanda's is a really cozy, intimate restaurant. The décor is warm, and there's a fireplace in the main room which is really inviting. I ordered the Salmon, which was good, but maybe a little under seasoned. The desert was very good and overall I enjoyed everything.  I would go back.
Great decor, service& food! Had crispy eggs w/prosciutto & asparagus. Bellini was fab! My friend had the croissant French toast and she cleaned her plate can't wait to go back ! Thank u yelpers

Amanda's, by far, is my most favorite restaurant in Hoboken. I have been here twice with my fiancé and both times have been absolutely amazing. The minute you walk in you're greeted by the friendly bartender who makes incredible cocktails, then a lovely hostess who asks for your name and coat, then you are greeted by, who I believe is Amanda herself (but I could be wrong - she seems like an owner). The service is perfect. Both of the servers we had were knowledgeable about the food and wine menu (which is very reasonably priced) and were able to give us great recommendations. They service is perfectly slow, if you know what I mean, you don't feel rushed whatsoever and you have time to enjoy and actually digest your courses. Compliments to the chef - the food is amazing. I recommend trying the "Duck Two Ways"...my mouth is watering just thinking about it. This establishment should be extremely proud of their staff and reputation...it really is a lovely place worth the visit!

I have been to Amanda's numerous times for brunch before, but this past Saturday I had a very mediocore experience due to the service. They really had no one there and it was pretty quiet for a Saturday afternoon. But the waiter we had, was really not pleased to be there and did not care to ask if we needed anything. The food is good but if the service is mediocore, it just ruins the brunch experience. Very disappointed and uncertain whether I will be coming back.

What a great surprise! You walk into a cozy bar with fireplace. You then enter into a beautiful Victorian style space. Not stuffy at all and views into the outdoors. Attentive wait staff and owner. Tables are spread out and you can actually have a conversation, a rarity in Hoboken. All 6 of us had positive food experiences! Free parking!!

My first time at Amanda's was amazing. The second time left much to be desired.The waiter was not accommodating in the slightest. Last time we were there they made us a special Sangria that was amazing, even though it wasn't on the menu. When I mentioned this to our waiter he acted like I had 5 heads and had just asked for custody of his first born. It was incredibly rude. To be honest, on that note alone, I almost wanted to get up and walk out. Oh wait, walk out? How could I when i was cramped at a table that was no longer than the width of a notebook and two dates were going on next to us. One couple drunker than the next or just over-hearing their problems was incredibly annoying to our night. It sort of ruined the romantic atmosphere we were going for. The food portion was small. My shrimp basmati was good but nothing outstanding and my fiance's scallops were so small he left hungry. That is not how you should walk out after spending $100 dollars. My latest impression is mediocre at best but knowing how wonderful it was last time compared to this, I can't help but be disappointed.

Had a work dinner here. Got to try the chicken and biscuit appetizer, mixed green salad, and glazed salmon over lobster mashed potatoes. All were delicious! The ambiance is warm and cozy. It was a lovely experience.

The dinner special at 5:30 is a great value.  The selections are limited but are all great.  The night I was there I had the cod fish.  You can order from the regular menu but it will cost more.  They also have a great selection of wine.

Food was delicious but serves on the other hand stunk. I had three serves and felt rushed a soon as I sat down and was handed a menu. Waiter number two came after a ten minute wait and no one taking a drink order, which I than order drink and food. I guess here you are only allowed one mimosas with your meal because I didn't see another server until I was done with my brunch. Mid way thru the meal I finished both my coffee and mimosa with barely no water left. Have to say with all the staff at hand that Amanda's need to tell them that they need to be more attentive to their customers.

There's a chronic issue of over-hyped, over priced, crowded places in Hoboken - This is not one of them.My parents were in town, so I thought it was time to give this place a try for dinner. I was blown away by the cute, homey decor, incredible service, delicious food & wine - Simply a great meal, as good if not better than any place in Manhattan.  Menu had many options and everything everyone got, from apps to entrees were great.  It is "nice" and feels more appropriate for an older crowd, but perfect for parents in town, dates, etc.  It is also pricey, yes, but worth every bite!I had brunch here and this was a little TOO nice - food was very good, but more than I like to pay - so I'd say better for dinner.  Will def. be back.

I really liked Sunday Brunch here. The prices are fair and the quality is GREAT. I had Eggs Benedict and it was perfect. The servers are very attentive and the atmosphere is very clean. I hope to return soon. This place is very family friendly! Perfect place for after church! Enjoy!

Made a reservation on Yelp 30 minutes before going, perfect! When we arrived, there was a line and once we checked in the hostess called our name next. I ordered the sweet pepper and cream cheese omelet. It was very good. My friend had the eggs benedict, also very good. Bloody Mary was delicious! The atmosphere is very nice and classy, can't wait to come back!

New England-Style Brunch Spot in HobokenBottom line:  Beautiful restaurant, great service, and tasty brunch.Tips:    Don't waste time looking for parking, they offer validation for a lot down the block    Opt for the Balthazar bread basket to start    The croissant French toast is delicious    Steer clear of the frittataAbout:  Regarded as one of the nicest restaurants in Hoboken, Amanda's lives up to its reputation.  With a very New England feel in the layout and decor, the large restaurant with multiple dining rooms actually has a very cozy feel.
