Food:  The meal started off with a tiny, spherical roll (really, the smallest roll I've seen) - which was fresh and delicious.  But, the table next to us had ordered the Balthazar bread basket which was definitely the way to go.  $8 for croissants, mini scones and danishes could almost be a meal in itself.-French toast - Made on croissants with seasonal fruit compote of mostly blueberries on top.  The croissant was a unique touch to make this classic dish extra special, fluffy and flakey. -Frittata - The frittata with eggplant, mozzarella and tomato was really just an omelet with cheese poured on top.  It wasn't nice to look at and wasn't the tastiest brunch I've had.  The eggs were too buttery/greasy, and there was way too much cheese pooling on the top.  Even after scraping of the excess cheese, I could barely taste the eggplant or tomato.  Definitely a disappointment in an otherwise lovely brunch.  The potatoes it came with were very good.-Both entrees came with a good amount of fresh fruit (watch out, the grapes have pits), instead of just a fruit garnish, which was a great addition.Atmosphere:  Again, a beautiful restaurant where the waiters and customers were dressed on the more formal side.  The layout with multiple rooms reminded me of a B&B, full of character.  The restaurant is great for couples, adult families, or a group of friends getting together to catch up.

My fiance and I were looking for somewhere to go on a cold Saturday evening when we decided on a whim to stop by Amanda's. A friend of ours has been there quite often for brunch so we decided to give it a try. Even though it was a busy Saturday night, they took us right in and seated us at a table in a separate room downstairs. At first, I was like "oh no, they're sticking us in the basement," but it was nice. The room was quaint and smelled pleasant and looked newly remodeled. There was a faux fireplace with some beautiful stained glass.The waitstaff was also very pleasant. The service was prompt and the prices were reasonable. We had the special for the evening - rib eye steak with au gratin potatos and vegetables - and a separate order of steak (a sirloin). I think the waiter was a bit surprised to see us house a ton of meat, but the food was AMAZING. Coupled with a bottle of wine (Malbec) and topped off with molten lava cake, the night was incredible.We definitely recommend eating at Amanda's and we are going to go back fairly soon - probably for brunch! ^_^

I was here for dinner and I must say I was impressed. Very classy, charming and intimate.Ambiance, food, service - five stars for all.They had ample vegetarian appetizers, I tried the truffle polenta and it was divine. They had just one entree pasta option for me but it was really good so no complains.This place is always packed so I recommend making a reservation.

I came here for a nursing conference and it was so good. Everything was great even the bread and butter. The appetizers were interesting but still delicious. The bread was soft and warm. I had the filet mignon and it was amazing. So good, but I was too full to finish it. I also had the chocolate lava cake which was great with the ice cream. It's a great place and a little hidden in Hoboken. Pricey but worth it.

Wonderful food, fantastic service, elegant atmosphere.I've eaten here several times, and always enjoyed it.  My fiance recently held her bridal shower here, in a private room.  The staff went out of there way to cater to her & the guests.  When I showed up at the end, they even helped us w/bringing the gifts out to the front to be loaded into my car.  Looking for a nice, quiet evening.  Romantic?  Here's your spot!

Another fantastic dining experience at Amanda's.We hit up the super reasonably priced early dinner for two special $32 total or, obviously, $16 each. (You have to order before 5:45, but the quality/quantity/price of the meal make eating at a dinner time intended of the elderly completely worthwhile.)After strutting into the establishment right after work and being seated at one of the quaint tables near the window, I ordered the cheapest red wine on the menu (yes, I'm classy.) I glanced at the prix fix menu, and what a menu it was! I was pleasantly surprised with the variety of meal choices available - this isn't your run of the mill limited 2-3 choice menu. Entree options included cod, skirt steak, pork loin, chicken, and ravioli. Translation? I can come back again and again for a variety of excellent meals. During our geriatric dinner I immensely enjoyed all three of my chosen courses. I started out with the soup of the day, a cream of corn. It was both creamy and scrumptious! More than just cream and corn, there was a delicate addition of pesto, carrots, bacon, and potato. Just the right amount of everything in harmony. For my main course I decided to get something I wouldn't make for myself - honey and sage marinated pork loin with asparagus and creamy polenta. I don't know if it's my favorite meal that I've ever had here, but it was definitely delicious. The polenta might have been the most interesting part the meal because it was done like a flavorful extra smooth mashed potato. To conclude my meal I choose the chocolate moose. It was presented beautifully with whipped cream and strawberries topping the moose which sat inside a dainty chocolate container. If I have my way, I'll definitely be having early dinner more often!

I came to eat the early bird dinner special with my boyfriend for our 2nd anniversary. The cozy decor and excellent service really made our day special! For starters, I had the polenta with the arugula pesto sauce and my boyfriend had the soup of the day. Both were excellent. For our entrees, I had the grilled salmon and he had the BBQ skirt steak, both were very delicious. As for dessert we had the chocolate mousse. I definitely recommend coming here if you're looking for a romantic date and the early bird special is really a great deal.

Made a brunch reservation through OpenTable for here just in case, but we ended up late and it turns out they close for about an hour or so before dinner service. We were being rushed to put our orders in, which I understood except the waiters kept circling us like hawks. I had the poached eggs with with crab hash, and it was pretty tasty. The potatoes were standard though. Can't say much for ambience since we were the only ones there having been late but the decor is warm and seems trendier than the other places in Hoboken.

People talk about Amanda's being a must try if your in Hoboken, but it might have lost its edge in a neighborhood saturated by dinning establishments.The average person's budget does not fit Amanda's menu, but not to worry - they do offer a prefix menu to early birds for dinner. This is probably the cheapest prefix deal in Hoboken and is well worth the quick commute home to make it in by 6PM. They can also pair your meal with a bottle of wine which is on special for prefix diners (i believe it's $20).Be sure to check it out the early bird menu here amandasrestaurant.com/me…Since dinning here I've had some nice meals and service. They put out a solid plate of food every course and it's refreshing to take someone to a restaurant that can live up to a reputation. They also do a very good Valentine's pre fix menu, but be sure to book that way in advanced since the good time slots can fill up rather quickly.

Came with the family for brunch; A+. The place is clean and has a nice warm leaving room decor. Service on point.I had Eggs Norwegian,  french toast (with croissant!).... My wife had some poach eggs  with crab. Everything was good. If u dont feel like cooking brunch, well thats the spot.

This place is super cozy and really cool inside. Went for dinner, haven't tried brunch yet. The food was very good.. We had the lamb meatballs to start, then the pork chop and sirloin. The pork chop was better than the sirloin, which I didn't love. The highlight was dessert... The banana cake and chocolate cake were ammmmazing. Service does make you feel a little rushed but I still highly recommend this place.
GoodBrunch atFair price onWashington. ThereIs often long waits. What are crispy eggs?

My husband and I have been to Amanda's twice now and have thoroughly enjoyed the experience both times.  It's definitely one of the nicer restaurants in Hoboken, and with a more romantic, upscale atmosphere.We've tried 2 appetizers, the mussels and polenta - both absolute perfection.As entrees we've tried the pork chop, scallops, and the cod with chorizo and clams which were all excellent.  Last time we were there, my husband had the shrimp - which was only ok.The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is that the service is not always great.  Last time particularly, our waiter was extremely slow and unattentive - he also hit a particular pet peeve of mine, in that I had completely finished my entree before he showed up with my wine.Overall, Amanda's is a great, romantic spot with great food.

Divine. This review is for brunch only. I recently met a couple friends for Sunday brunch here, based on Yelp hype... thanx yelpers! I'll pass on the brunch recommendations without reservation.The food was really top-notch. The rolls brought to the table when we were all seated were sort of a throw away, but were fresh and were a nice touch for those not ordering a large bread basket.The clear highlight of our meals was my friend's crispy eggs, so I'll start with that dish. Crispy eggs are poached eggs that were frozen, then covered in panko bread crumbs and fried. They were fabulous - the frying perfectly crisped the panko while rewarming but not overcooking the eggs. Modernist cuisine techniques that were used to be delicious, rather than just impressive. The dish came with prosciutto, asparagus, porcini mushrooms, greens and I think a couple other things. It was really terrific.My classic eggs benedict was also wonderful - creamy, decadent hollandaise, everything perfectly prepared and seasoned, and accompanied by ripe fruit and potatoes. Although I think the potatoes could have been slightly better had they been all cut the same sizes, they were really good as they were.My friend's warm sliced chicken breast over mixed greens with currants and pecans was similarly yummy, and was exactly what she wanted. Bellinis and coffee were common, nothing I'd write home about.Service was just about flawless. We were greeted warmly and our coats were checked promptly. Although our party wasn't complete, we were immediately given a table in accordance with our reservation, and we were not hassled due to our lateness or the fact that we stayed and chatted even after we finished eating, even though the restaurant was constantly full. Water glasses were constantly refilled, and our server was charming and knowledgeable. No complaints.The restaurant is cozy and, despite its size, great for conversation without feeling like you were listening in on neighboring tables or having them listen to your conversations. Clean, nothing fancy, just nice.Make a reservation (phone/ online) - this place is popular! Also, parking in a garage a few blocks away is validated for 3 hours (see the website).We're all looking forward to coming back!

Literally the best brunch ever. Go for brunch. MUST GO FOR BRUNCH! okay I think I got my point across...Overall: freakin delicious - french bistro-esque estate decor - extremely attentive staffFOOD: lobster bisque .thebestever.              crispy eggs with shiitake. numnumnum.             ginger creme bruleI often come here with my mom. It's a very cute girls morning out activity.

After reading the great reviews my husband and I with our baby in a stroller decided to give it a try.  I can say it was the worst experience I've had in a while.  I had to wait for sugar for my tea, by this time my tea had gotten luke warm.  Eggs were served, no salt and pepper...then no ketchup for potatoes.  I mean The amount of time I waited, I couldn't have just gone to the kitchen and gotten it myself.  Then we asked our waitress for hot water to warm up baby's bottle, she never game back and 10 minutes had passed. Now we have a crying baby...finally I went to the bar yet again to get something- this time hot water.  What a mess!  The inside dining room was packed but simple setting up of a table with the basic necessities is first step in being a waitress.  Oh! and our omelette didn't have cheese....i mean come on get something right!  I hate writing such reviews.....Not going back to this place...but you can give it a try - didn't find the food to be all that special.  And there is no baby changing table.  There is a bench in the women's bathroom- manager said this is what we call a changing table ( i wanted say in America we call that a bench and it's used for sitting not changing diapers)

I've been to Amanda's three times for brunch and have enjoyed it every time. I got the turkey club twice - and it's very tasty. I got poached eggs a couple of weeks ago, and they were fine, but the dish was very small, especially compared to everyone else's. But I would go again to try something new. The service is good and the place is very nice - looks like an old house that's been converted. You really need to make a reservation on the weekends, but one time they even squeezed us in when our original restaurant turned out to be a dud and we left.

I went for brunch last Sunday and put my coat in the coat check with my leather cashmere gloves in the pockets.  When my coat was returned, my gloves were mysteriously gone.  I immediately told someone and I got yelled at and blamed for it, and that they're not responsible for any lost or stolen items.  As the owner Eugene was yelling at me - he called me racist for blaming them.Also - my table was right behind the host stand and I heard a lady who had returned in and said that the coat check gave her the wrong scarf and was returning it.  Bottom line. DO NOT CHECK YOUR COAT - YOU WILL REGRET IT.

We had our engagement party in the private room downstairs and it was absolutely perfect!  We had about 25 guests and everyone LOVED the food.  The service was top notch too. Amanda's even made the planning of the party so easy. All our guests had a wonderful time and we would highly recommend!

This is definately a GOOD place for brunch. Reservation is a must however,  in case you just walk in - you will not be dissapointed since both the food & drinks are really good. We got there around 1 pm - which is late for brunch, but still it was packed. Definately coming back here :)

Came here with my grandparents and my parents. Great food, little expensive but not too bad. My waitress had zero personality which was fine. They place was pretty empty though (it was a Monday). Waitress only reason I did not give I 5 stars.

This is a brunch spot I would definitely come back to when in Hoboken! It's tucked away on Washington street and a reservation is needed on a busy Saturday afternoon. My friend and I decided to split a little bit of sweet and savory by ordering the croissant French toast with berries and crispy eggs. It was a perfect mix of both with a side of fresh squeezed orange juice. The croissant was flaky and light and not heavy- but you're definitely filled after one croissant in a plate of two. The crispy eggs balanced out the sweet even though I had to add a bit more salt on top because we ordered veggie style - without prosciutto which was probably the salt needed. This was a great start to our day of shopping and not too harsh on the wallet either.

Our nephew made reservations here for a family dinner to celebrate hubby's birthday.  The restaurant was homey (it is a converted brownstone, after all) and seemed to attract multi-generational families which is always nice to see.  Music from the 70's and 80's.  Food was ok.  Three of us ordered cod but our servicer came back and said they only had two orders left (this on a Sunday at 7:30pm; I thought cod was their most popular dish so was surprised that they were out).  The cod, not a huge piece of fish, was plated on top of a huge pile of mashed potatoes.  All in all, food and service were only ok.  If you want to be time-warped backed to the 80's, then this may be your kind of place.  It wasn't for me.
Pretty good brunch spot! The ambiance and wait staff are amazing!

Brunch was outstanding.  Food was hot and fresh.  My fiancé ordered bellinis, which were really good.  The Balthazar bread basket is great.  I'm looking forward to going back.Only negative: coffee was decent at best.  Get your coffee first somewhere else.

Amanda, you're a sweetie of a brunch spot, and I totally want to give you another try. But why must you make me wait so? Can't you see I'm hungry for some of your sugar coated loving?Calvin J., Jon F., and I went for brunch at Amanda's. which I found on Yelp. The menu is very reasonably priced, there's a good selection, and everything comes with a side of fruit! (Win.) The portions are generous and the quality excellent. Jon F also commented that the selection of the bar was top-notch. The service was cordial and I loved the tea-time femininity of the restaurant. You felt like you were eating in the smaller dining room of your rich Aunt Ruthie's where everything is shiny and smells of butter. The place is a little crowded, but not so much that you feel like you have to shout to be heard or knock elbows with your neighbor. But for a meal where we all only ordered entree's, why were we there for two hours? We were seated immediately, and while the place was full, it could hardly warrant a 45 minute wait to eat. We inquired after our meal twice. I want to like you. I really do. The food was good and that alone would give you 4.5 stars. But the wait time and poor communication really knocks an extra star off for me. Perhaps I'll come back for a very very leisurely dinner?
Food, service & ambiance at Amanda's is excels! A wonderful dinner & experience! thank you!

It's a day before my birthday, but just for the heck of it, I milk it for all it is worth, so we came here for brunch on a Sunday. Since it was sort of a surprise, my boyfriend told me to dress "neat casual", so I dress my definition of "neat casual". This place was just that.. neat and casual, from the decor to the service to the food. The food was nothing to rave about, and it wasn't terribly overpriced. The freshly squeezed orange juice mimosa was NICEeeee.. but with good company, even the most mediocre of foods can taste great!
I came here for a friend's brunch/bridal shower. The staff couldn't be more helpful, and the food was fantastic. I was surprised by the size of the restaurant as well.Definitely would go back!

Food and service were great!  Very helpful staff.  Made a reservation and got there early and was able to sit for a while.  Love the decor.  Food was so good, wish I could've fit it all in my stomach!

I love brunch. Who doesn't? Eggs benedict, bloody mary's, vanilla bourbon french toast--too much deliciousness to go around.  With that said, I've been to quite a few brunch places between Hoboken and Jersey City, but they don't seem to understand good food service. For this reason I have yet to rate any restaurant 5 stars until now.Hands down Amanda's has the best brunch service in all of Hoboken and Jersey City.  I brunched there this weekend and the food and service was impeccable.  We made reservations, and were actually seated upon our arrival (that never happens)!  As soon as we sat down our drink orders were taken.  The menu was original, and didn't have half ass copies of whatever other brunch spots do.  I had the poached eggs with crab hash, which I haven't seen anywhere else (and it was very good).  Also, I was delighted by the side of fresh fruit came with the meal.  The food came out quickly, even though it seemed pretty busy.  And the waiter even remembered to our coffee refills were decaf.  I really like the homey decor, but my boyfriend did complain the tables/chairs were a little small for him.  Other than that it was a great experience!

If you're looking for a nice place to eat, go here. We had a reservation for 5 people during the Early Dinner time (5-5:30) and honestly, it's the best deal and meal we've had in nj!! What an Early Dinner will provide you with is a full three course meal (appetizer, entree and dessert) for ONLY $16 per person. Such a great deal!! The food is delicious as well!!Today the choices for the appetizer course was a mixed salad with Sonoma goat cheese and golden raisins (really good! The cheese was fresh and I usually dislike eating goat cheese but It was so fresh that I ate every morsel of the cheese!), White Bean Vegetable soup (really yummy, a lot of vegetables and great for the cold weather) and cheese polenta with red pepper coulis (really good, the sauce was great!)The Entree choices were great too! I got the cod with curry lentils and smoked tomatoes and it was soooooo good! The lentils had great smoky flavor to it and I really enjoyed it. My grandma got the chicken with almond and cranberry sauce and she enjoyed that as well. The dessert choice was a keylime pie ( really nice balance of tartness and sweetness with light whipped cream), chocolate mousse and apple streudal with raisins (crispy pie crust with warm apples inside, can't get better than that!) The atmosphere is so relaxing and it's gorgeous. I felt like I time travelled back into the 1900's because te building offered great original architectural features!Overall great service, food and experience but I highly recommend going during the early dinner.

Having dined several times over the years- this was by far one of the worst experiences ever.  I will say in the end they did the right thins. Service was beyond sub par with too many things wrong to mention.I must say the pollenta app, beat and avocado salad and lobster bisque were amazing- that was the ONLY redeeming thing about the evening. The chicken, steak and tuna entrees were inedible. Could not swallow the chicken and it was only the second time in my life I sent an entree back.  We poured our own wine the entire night- service was lacking.  I WILL GIVE THEM MAJOR POINTS FOR THIS... everyone has off nights- this was really off. The manager was very nice and receptive. I had a nice one off with him on the side. He took off two of the entrees (which we did not ask him to do) and he even offered complimentary desert (which we passed on).  We tipped on the total check- as if the entrees were on there. Honestly service was bad but it's a tough job waiting tables.  The measure of a business or person is not in the mistakes they make but in how they handle it and rectify them. I am impressed with how well they cared about it and for that alone I will go back.  I have never had a bad experience like this and was floored- but I want to go back just to prove to myself that all those other great times were truly great.

I came here for my cousin's baby shower brunch and the food was delish. There were a lot of us that went and N0T one person in our group had any complaints. Everyone was satisfied about what they ordered. I would go  again when I'm in the area.
Very nice place.   Family took me here for my Father's Day Brunch and I really enjoyed it.  Food was great but it was a bit pricey.  Staff was amazing and attentive.
Had wonderful experience! Service, foods and atmosphere are all great! One of the finest restaurant in Hoboken!

Well executed food, warm service, pleasant dining experience.I had the smoked trout salad to start--the dressing complemented the endives and trout, and the whole dish was seasoned perfectly.I wasn't particularly hungry, so I had the mussel appetizer for my main.  The mussels were very tender and the broth was tasty.  It came with grilled foccacia, which was good, but sort of fell apart when dipped in the broth.  I think it would've been improved had it been toasted more--or a harder bread might have gone better with this dish.My boyfriend had the mushroom farfalle, which was excellent.  It came with a cream sauce, which I often find to be too heavy, but this was perfect, and the mushrooms and scallions added some freshness and lightness to the dish.I actually wasn't too enticed by many of the other dishes on the menu (it seems like they overcomplicate some items), but I would come back here based on the quality of the food we had.  I've been here once before for their early dinner, and enjoyed that as well.I loved the ambiance of the restaurant--very intimate and cozy.

Lovely place, great food and the waiters are well trained. Pleasant place, great music. We were there for the early dinner and we ate well, deliciously, abundantly and for a good price. My meat was tender and juicy and that creamy polenta is a great asset. Liked the way they serve the soup on the plate at the moment it arrives and my lemon tarte at the end was superb. Will definitely go back as it's difficult to find such good places nowadays.

Awesomely delicious fare! It's been awhile since I ate there so I no longer remember the name of the dishes but the flavor impression they left will never go away. Service is very friendly and knowledgeable. The ambiance is romantic or a quiet relaxing dinner should you deem your date unworthy of this yummy yet pricey food.
I visit Amanda's a lot! Excellent food with top-notch service. I recommend the mushroom pasta.

Definitely one of the best restaurants in Hoboken. Staff is friendly and welcoming, they are knowledgeable about the menu and willing to answer questions. I've only been here twice - once for pre-fixe Mother's Day menu and once for brunch. The pre-fixe menu isn't cheap but the food was terrific. They even gave my mom a tomato plant as a parting gift, which I thought was super thoughtful.Brunch was also very good. I had the club sandwich - only mediocre part of the meal was the potato straws. There was a heap of them on the plate and I didn't even make a dent, not much flavor to speak of. I tried the crispy eggs, very good and very unique. Would definitely recommend this place to someone looking to book something for a special occasion. I also noticed several private party areas.

This review is for their early bird dinner special which is a steal- you can't beat 3 courses for $16!If you come between 5-6 M-Sat, there is a special 3 course dinner for $16 per person with $20 bottles of wine.The atmosphere is great, like you are in an old victorian home.  The service is also fabulous.  I had black bean soup for an appetizer, cod with potatoes and fennel for my main and chocolate mousse for dessert.  Everything was delicious and the food was plated beautifully.While I love the early dinner special, I don't think the food is spectacular enough for the regular prices.  Also, I was hungry around 10pm, since eating dinner at 5:30 is much earlier than my usual dinner time.Great place to take your parents if they are in town, and send them home so you can go out after!
Came with here with a group of 6 ladies and had a blast. Drinks were good and food was great. Nice atmosphere and excellent service. Fun for an active night out or intimate dinner.
I can always count on Amanda's to take my out of town guests. The ambiance, service and food are consistently good and the cocktails are fun. Great little bar at the entrance.

Food: 4/5Decor: 3.5/5Service: 4/5Wine List 3/5    not many selection available but they have some of good value winesOverall: 4.2/5One of the best value restaurant in NJ.  I would give them 5/5 if they are BYOB ( I wish) J/KTheir food is not over the top but always good enough to enjoy your meal.  Good service and nice atmosphere for romantic diner and fun group diner.  They also have a private room downstairs so you are planning to have a small private party, you should check this place.  However, they have group menu (minimum 50-60pp) but still good value.  Oh! Try their early diner menu between 5-5:30pm Mon- Sat which is absolutely great ($32 per COUPLE for 3 course menu).  Bit noisy place but I'm OK.  I can recommend this restaurant to anyone who's looking to pay $$ ($100-120) for fine cozy dining.  Just go there!

I realize this place is better known for their brunch. With that said, this rating is for dinner ONLY. I will have to try brunch another time. 3.5 STARS for dinner. Food - hits and misses - 3Atmosphere - 4Service - 4 Price - N/AI came here on Hudson County restaurant week with a large party. First things first, the service was great! One waitress and a few helpers but she got the place moving. She tried to change our wine glasses with each different bottle we got but soon realized after the 2nd bottle that we really didn't care anymore so put an end to that quickly. Based on their pre-fixed menu. I had the cod which came out EXCELLENT. However, my appetizer, the calamari was HORRIBLE. They had a very good wine list. $30 + bottles. We have the private room in the basement. Beautifully decorated. They voucher parking tickets for up to 3 hours! I feel like I'm doing injustice by rating their dinner (and pre-fix) menu. But if you are planning to go there for dinner... 3.5 stars.

First time visit. Wonderful ambience! Tremendous service! Had pork Eggs Benedict and Lobster Bisque. Bisque was delicious! Eggs were cold so that sort of ruined the mood. :(    Otherwise all was great!

This place came as a suggestion to try from our realtor when we were looking for a new home.. Figured its got to be good if its fromour realtor.. you know they are trying to sell us on the area right?! Well no.. this place was just super generic and nothing special at all. I had the eggs benedict and the gf had the omelette. Both were very plain and lacked the slightest hint of salt. The star of my meal was the bloody mary which was still only generic. For the pirce (which is wasnt high at all) id expect a bit better food... On to the next..

Booooooo!The servers at Amandas are sloppy and depressed. The manager gave me the creeps. I don't even remember the food because the vibe was like a black pit of sadness. We will never go there again.

Went here for brunch and I must say it is a very delightful experience! The atmosphere is quaint and cozy. I had the crispy eggs which were delicious. The Bloody Mary is made with a pepper infused vodka and was delicious. Will definitely come again!
Great date place.  A little on the expensive and fancy side but excellent food and service.
Good food, skirt steak and eggs were done perfectly. The staff is friendly and attentive. The crispy eggs were excellent. Highly recommended.

Had a nice brunch at Amanda's last Sunday...again very nice service...crispy eggs were delicious...others enjoyed the turkey club and the hanger steak and eggs (although some of the steak was pretty chewy) all in all dining at Amanda's is always enjoyable!

I have been here for brunch which was always great. I went here for dinner last night and was extremely disappointed. The menu is very limited and the portion size for an entree was tiny. I wanted to order a side of which there were only three options. I had the blue cheese potatoe dish which tasted of nothing else except blue cheese. For dinner I cannot recommend Amanda's with so many other great options around.
The best place in Hoboken hands down. Definitely a unique place for Hoboken,  restaurants are usually memorable for all of the wrong reasons, but Amanda's is memorable for all the right ones.

New American executed well with some innovative dishes.  The creamy polenta with wild mushrooms was an excellent appetizer, but the real stand out was the incredible key lime pie for dessert.   Atmosphere is classy and quaint.  Service was decent, but wait was a bit excessive.  It shouldn't take 50 minutes to get an entree.  All in all, this place is a needed entity in the hoboken world of sports bars and pub food.

Pretty good. Service was above average and the food was above average as well relative to the prices. We were somewhat limited since we went with the dinner special choice. Would go back again to try something different.

Love love love this place! This is the #1 brunch place around here. Such a classy vibe + great food. I always order the poached eggs-amazing. Also try the creamy polenta when getting brunch! So good. I highly recommend this place.

Pleasantly surprised.  The food was very good.  I can't quite give it 5 stars but I think 4 is very fair.Several meals were on the table.  The mussel appetizer is one I highly recommend.  It's a very generous portion of mussels.  The other appetizers weren't as memorable.  For the mains the pork chop and the chicken both got a lot of love from those who tried it while the short ribs were good but not blow your mind.The service was outstanding which pushes this place to 5 star level.  Glasses were kept constantly full.  They came back to ask us if we wanted more bread.  Just excellent.
Nice spot for a date. Great wine selection and the food is excellent. A little small space wise but it is Hoboken so what isn't.
5 of 5 for the price point. Felt like The Great Gatsby would have eaten here. 1920s feel, dark wood, chandeliers. Sensational food. One of my two favorite places in Hoboken.

Amanda's is a gem of a place. The food was delicious, not a weak link during our meal! Our server was spot on and very attentive. I would highly recommend Amanda's...cannot beat Friday 1/2 price bottles of wine! Seriously! As for the Hudson Restaurant Menu, Slow Braised Lamb Crepe, Pork Loin & Key Lime Pie are the way to go, all were amazing! Get your azz in there, what are you waiting for??!!!

One of the few spots in hobo worth frequenting regularly!! Take advantage of their pre fixe, but if not... Some of the best dishes in town.  Classic ambiance, above avg flavors, reasonable prices... Nice spot for a date or small gathering!! Lobster bisque is silky smooth but robust with flavor!! Lamb dish, can't get enough, short ribs beyond amazing...

Came for Sunday brunch. Didn't live up to the hype. It was just mediocre. Our waitress wasn't good and they  brought out burned food that was had to send back. They tried to make excuses instead of apologizing too, which just shows poor management.

Whenever I have family or friends visiting Hoboken, this is my go-to restaurant to make reservations {for both brunch and dinner}.  The ambiance makes you feel like you are \ sitting down for a meal at your grandmother's house- simple and homey.  The entrees taste fresh and homemade...like no corners have been cut.  And I love that the menu is constantly being updated depending on what is in season.Solid choice.

Amanda's is great. Everything from the venue to the staff to the food! Thanks to Yelp we found Amanda's when we decided to avoid NYC rush hour traffic and find a nice meal before heading home to Pennsylvania. The good news is the plan worked better than we could have imagined.
We love this restaurant for the early dinner special.  What a great deal on fine dining, excellent food and romantic ambiance.
Valentines day Feb 2013, food was great, service was even better. old school charm

After much pleading from my girlfriend, we finally made it to Amanda's for brunch on Sunday morning. Upon entering the hostess asked us for the name on our reservation, we figured since we didn't have one there would be a long wait, but we were seating right away. One notable about Amanda's is the ambiance; it is sophisticated yet comforting. If you are going for brunch, casual dress is appropriate, but I assume for dinner, nicer dress attire would be called for. It was different having a full place setting for brunch, but I was happy when a server brought out bread before our appetizer. I wasn't a fan of the bloody Mary I had, but the bellini was pretty good. The smoked salmon app was great, I would order it again for sure. I was a bit disappointed with the entrees. They were OK, but I expected much better. I had the eggs benedict, and my girlfriend ordered the crab hash with poached eggs. Both dishes were a bit sloppy, like the chef just threw them together without caring about presentation. The taste was a nothing to write home about , it wasn't one of the better eggs benedicts I have had. (eggs benny is my go to brunch item) Another notable is the service, our server was great, and the other servers were prompt with clearing dishes and filling up water glasses. Overall its one of the nicest brunch spots I have been to in Hoboken, I just hope next time the food is a little better, everything else about Amanda's was great.

Well done, Amanda's!My son and daughter-in-law took me to dinner here on Father's Day -- couldn't have asked for a better present.Handsome dining room, outstanding meal, interesting (and very affordable wine list...and terrific service.In a town with a plethora of excellent dining options, none are better than Amanda's.

We had the special prefix early seating 5 and 530 pm. I liked that they also gave us the regular menu. The prefix early special was indeed special....two meals 32.00. Includes appetizer, entree, and desert. Everything was exceptional including the service and atmosphere. We added a bottle wine, espresso and tea. We will be back to order from the regular menu.

Brunch here is reasonably priced and the food is pretty tasty. The restaurant is elegant and classy, like dining in someone's tastefully decorated Parisian home. The hostess was great and even took our coats, but our server was a bit inattentive, forgetting to bring the coffee and not checking on us to see if we needed anything after our food arrived. When we finally managed to flag her down for ketchup, we were already halfway done with brunch. I'd give this place 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding up for the cute, cozy atmosphere.
A classy, hotel like restaurant. Superb decor and service. Brunch was good but not extraordinary. We came for the a nice quiet Sunday experience.

I ate here years ago and had very fond memories.  I decided to give it another go about 3 weeks ago.  It was just my fiance and I and we were celebrating my b-day.  As I walked in, I remember how cozy and charming Amanda's was.  Ordered a martini to start things off and the bartender seemed to make a decent one.  As for the food...I have to say that it lacked a bit in the flavor department that night.  I had a seabass dish that was cooked nicely, but kinda lacked seasoning.  There was a light tomato broth on the dish and no matter how much i coated that fish in it, it still was a bit bland on the taste buds.  I forget what my fiance had, but she had a similar comment about it not quite being there in terms of flavor.  We split a gnocchi appetizer also.  Flavor-wise, it was on point, but it was TINY!  I thought we had a good waiter, but I wish he would have told us how small it was and we probably would have decided to order 2 instead.Don't get me wrong....Amanda's is good, but for the reputation (per some other yelp reviews even!), I expected just a tad more.  I would try this place again in the future and see what happens.  BTW, their sister restaurant, The Elysian, is pretty cool.  I have been there 5 or 6 times. Their dining room is nice, but they have a cool bar and bar menu which can be nice for a late night burger...when you wanna keep it classy.

Had brunch here and enjoyed it immensely. Although not the same bang for your buck as Madison's, the quality was a step up. I had the eggs Benedict with salmon and spinach. My wife had the chopped salad which was also very good. Service was also excellent. Good spot.
PROS:quiet and romanticprofessional staffunderstated decorgreat menu selectionfull barCONS: may need a reservationno parking (like mostly anywhere in Hoboken!)

We were looking for a comfortable place to talk over business, and have good food, and Amanda's exceeded both expectations.  The fish was excellent (I had the trout and my colleague had the salmon), and the featured wine, a 2011 Pinot, was very drinkable and affordable at $35 and worked well with the food.  The best part was the service, which was a lot better than anything else I've experienced so far in New Jersey ;)

As the Yelp rating signified when I selected 5 stars - "as good as it gets." This is a top notch spot for brunch, which is what I am reviewing Amanda's for. The menu has a lot of amazing options, most of which are in some variety of egg. Every time I have gone to Amanda's, everyone enjoyed their food. I have gotten the Eggs Benedict w/ Crab Hash (A+) and club sandwich - neither have disappointed, and they were brought to the table in less than 15 minutes. There are a few local beers on tap, as well as an assortment of brunch cocktails - all very good.The service is the best in town. The restaurant is extremely classy on the inside, but don't get the impression that it is at all stuffy - there is no standard dress code with people ranging from jeans and a sweatshirt to formal (depending on occasion). It can get very busy on the weekends during prime brunch hours, so make a reservation if you are with a larger party or on a strict schedule.Finally, the pricing is almost too good to be true. At a place like Amanda's - where decorative plates are used as placeholders and the waiters wear bow ties - one might expect the price to reflect this. Not the case - considering the size of the portions and the quality of the food, paying $11-$14/plate is certainly reasonable.Best brunch in Hoboken.

Had dinner here with my friends who live in the area. I can see why they like this restaurant. Friendly staff. Good food. Nicely decorated. 'Finding parking was a challenge. But then again all businesses in any popular area in any state is like this...so I wasn't put off by this at all.

Outstanding restaurant. The food was delicious and the decor was very classy. The atmosphere was dressy to casual and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. I had no complaints. My girl loved her entree and dessert. If you're looking for a special occasion, look no further than Amanda's. You won't be disappointed.

I went here with my parents for my college graduation dinner. This place is classy, with nice decor, but the tables are somewhat cramped as far as legroom goes. Everyone in my party got a different dish and everything was absolutely outstanding. We also had no difficulties making substitutions from the "default" sides that were listed with our meals. Our waiter was attentive, and for dessert there was even I even had congratulations spelled out on my plate in chocolate sauce! This place is rather pricey, but it's the best food and service I've ever had in Hoboken.
Service is good. Ambience is great. The main dishes are better than the apps.

Classy, sophisticated restaurant on Hoboken.  It's pricey, but the food is worth it.  With all the bars and restaurants geared for the younger, fraternity boy crowd on Washington Street, Amanda's stands out as being really classy and nice place to take a quiet, romantic date or to celebrate a milestone with your friends and family.  We came here for Restaurant Week and had a wonderful prix fixe meal with some friends for a great price.  The service was very attentitve.

Took my boyfriend here for dinner on a friday night for his birthday.  Have been waiting to come here since moving to hoboken in December as the restaurant is supposed to be one of the best here in Hoboken.  In my opinion, the food is very mediocre and overpriced.  I do not mind spending money on a good meal at all but this meal was just eh. We started with two small salads- nothing special.  As an entree, my boyfriend had the sirloin ($34 dollars - would have been acceptable if it was more like $25) which had a monster vein running through it with a crunchy burnt crust on it.  The meat itself unfortunately was no better than something you may find at a friends BBQ.  His potatoes au gratin were delicious though. I had the cod ($28 dollars - would have been acceptable at $20), which was somewhat crunchy and rubbery at the same time.  Flavors on both meals were just okay. As for the service, there was atleast 10 people working in the dining room, however none of which were attentive enough to refill our wine glasses/water or take our plates once our meals were finished.  We literally sat there and saw our waiter and multiple bus boys walk by us 10 times for a good twenty minutes doing nothing with our plates that were waiting to be picked up. Mind you, this place was not that busy and I am very patient as I have worked in many restaurants in my life and also I had no reason to rush on this particular night.  My boyfriend who always needs a dessert, was indifferent about ordering one because the meal had already taken so long and we were just over it.  I forced him to get the molten cake (not worth getting at all) because about an hour before i called to ask them to either put a candle in his dessert or write happy birthday or anything they could do.  Very nicely, the host on the phone took his name down and said, "absolutely, we will do something, see you soon".  So of course the cake comes with nothing on it and I just laughed and told my boyfriend what had happened.  No big deal, we finished up, asked for the check and instead of the check, minutes later a bowl of ice cream comes with a candle.  Whattt??? We had dessert, we want to go home now.  So strange, we laughed a little harder and finally got the check.  Unfortunately, this was our first and last time at Amanda's.  Our mediocre dinner totaled $133.00 before tip.  For the equal price or less, just jump on the Path and head into NYC for an entirely better experience.
Definitely one of the classiest restaurants in Hoboken. For what you get, it is actually probably one of the better bargains too.

We had a party of four and everybody was pleased. The place  our table felt a bit claustrophobic and the waiter kept bumping in to me. I had the salmon and it was good, not great. If I could give it 3 and 1/2 stars I would. My friends love it but I don't know why.

Been here a few times and it is definitely one of my favorite Hoboken restaurants.  Food is consistently very good and the menu choices always sounds very elegant.  Great selection of wines and generally reasonably priced.  The decor is very traditional but not overly stuffy.  Had the back room once and it is ideal for a group of 5-6 - you have your own space but it is not completely isolated from the rest of the dining room so you still feel like you are with others.  The real treat is to get the dining table downstairs near the wine cellar - I believe it is for larger groups but very special.
Great place for a nice dinner. It's roomy, has a nice home-style feeling to it. Great for special occasions

I came back here for dinner with my parents and bf. It was their first time meeting each other so it was an important occassion.  I'd say the dinner was pretty good but the ambiance is a bit older and stuffier for an older audience.  I had a pre-fixed early dinner meal: mixed green salad, sauteed cod, key lime pie.  It was a fairly okay meal.  Portions were smaller so I didn't feel overly stuffed by the whole thing.  My diet coke was flat so I had to send it back, but the mixed greens were fresh.  Sauteed cod was a bit bland.  Keylime pie was REALLY REALLY tart.  Also, it looked like it was melting as it was slumped over on the plate.  However, the price is pretty awesome to be eating in a place like that.  We also had the option to get a bottle of wine with the meal for $20.  Good deal!  I think I just picked the bad choices of the menu.  My dad picked the polenta and it was really awesome.  He chose the hanger steak and that also was really good.  Lastly, he got the Apple-raisin Streudel.  I was reaching over and eating off his plate; it was so good.  Overall, the ambiance is lovely for a "proper" meal  and the price was unbeatable.  The quality of food though is probably better for brunch though.

Delish!! Just thinking about my brunch at Amanda's makes my mouth water - YUM!I've been to Amandas before for dinner, which I thought was pretty good, but the brunch here was amazing.  We started with the mimosas, which were tasty and had just the right amount of alcohol in them to make me nice and buzzed. I got the sweet pepper omelet, which was cooked perfectly and was rich with flavor. My boyfriend got a club sandwich with ham - it too was delish. I really loved this place. It has a great atmosphere, good service, and yummy food. I'll def. be back for more.

Good place with friendly wait staff and well prepared food. I wish I could give it 3.5 stars because although I have no complaints about the food or staff, there was nothing special about this place... Being in New York all the time, its difficult to give 4 and 5 stars to places that just don't jump out at you. The descriptions for the dished were so boring that my girl and I were not very enthusiastic about ordering....pan roasted fish, grilled tuna, marinated grilled chicken breast (seriously...who goes out to a nice restaurant to order chicken breast?!? americans...), a flank steak and a sirloin. We ordered the steaks and the food was flavored well but the steaks were slightly overcooked (I guess that's what I get for ordering a steak outside a new york steak hour...). The best thing about this place was that all bottles of wine were half off! Sweetness. They also have a pre fixe as well so if that's your thing, you can do that as well. I think based on the reviews, I'll need to come back for the brunch and lunch.

Very nice brunch.  Has an old-fashioned, highfalutin' decor, (i.e., seems like a nice place for "high tea", meal served on nice china), but the food was delicious and the prices were reasonable for someone who is acclimated to NYC pricing.  Service was great. No complaints here! Felt like you were eating brunch in a Victorian living room, but nonetheless was very comfortable.

Staff is always friendly and professional.  Intimate, welcoming decor, excellent food, great service - definitely a must try at least once.  Love the lobster bisque during Sunday brunch (I'm a total fattie) and their brunch cocktails.

I went to Amanda's  for dinner on a Friday night and everything was wonderful. We made a reservation 5 days in advance and we were seated right when we arrived. When we arrived at Amanda's we were freezing cold, and it was such a welcome to go into the restaurant and feel the fire in the fireplace and the warmth and smells from the kitchen. It was a really nice way to enter a restaurant. When we went it was Hudson County restaurant week and so my mom and I got the pre-fixed restuarant week menu for $35.00, which included an appetizer, entree, and dessert. I had the endive and beet salad which was a little small (less than a cup of food), and then I had the french cut chicken with roasted brussel sprouts, carrot puree and winter orzo. It. Was. Amazing. The chicken was so moist and perfectly cooked, and very flavorful, and the brussel sprouts were so flavorful. My mom got the short ribs with blue cheese polenta. We also had red wine (I don't remember which) off the recession wine list which I thought was very cleverly named. For dessert my mom had the bread pudding, and I had the key lime pie which I read was amazing...and it definitely lived up to its review. It was tart, but not too tart, and very flavorful. I definitely intend to go back. I really want to try it for  brunch, and during the summer. It was so cozy and relaxing and the wait staff offered wonderful dinner suggestions. I will definitely be back!

While visiting friends in Hoboken we decided to stop in at Amanda's for lunch. I was pleasantly surprised by the great food, wonderful service and unique atmosphere. The restaurant provides an elegant yet homey feel that comforts you with a warm fireplace. It was a perfect place to get in from the rain and have some girl time over some afternoon drinks. The service was friendly and attentive- even though it was noticeably under staffed for the large parties that we in the back area of e restaurant. The menu had an array of selections from soup, salads and breakfast to full entrees. I enjoyed the fresh greens salad with chicken- yummy! Take a walk downstair to the restroom and check out the wine cellar!Next time I am in Hokenboken I will be going back to Amanda's!

Great food, great service. Appreciative that the restaurant seeks to serve an adult clientele as opposed to bringing in young children.  Great adult atmosphere where you can enjoy a quality meal from quality staff.

Great brunch spot!Their brunch menu is interesting and unique, but not too different and confortable to try. Price is just right, and portion is big. Service was welcoming and friendly.On a Sunday morning, they were having two parties on the 1st floor and in the downstairs. This place is actually not small, it's just seperated into some rooms. Both looked like baby shower or birthday party with kids and family. I think this place would be perfect for these.I would recommend to try something you wouldn't see at regular brunch.I ordered eggs benedict. It was good, but you could find it anywhere. My company tried crispy eggs with asparagus and shitake mushrooms - which had strong mashroom flavor and was so good. Great for brunch, but not a boring stuff. Don't hesitate to try new things here.I'd love to try dinner here next time.

We hosted a lunch for 10 girls celebrating the upcoming birth of our daughter's first child.  Jonathan was extremely helpful with the planning, was very flexible with the menu, even with last minute changes, and provided a perfect private spot for the party on a busy Saturday afternoon.  They printed a special menu which included a choice of two appetizers, three entrees and several desserts.  We chose the grilled salmon, seared skirt steak and quiche/salad.  All were ordered, all were excellent.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere was cozy.  A wonderful experience at Amanda's.

We went for a Christmas dinner with colleagues. I like the place. Lot of space, classy atmosphere, good food, great service. The 4 stars is a bit of a stretch based on the food (average salad and desert) but the ambience and service made it up.

Visited Amandas on a friday night I was a bit apprehensive after reading a few yelp reviews  which criticized the service. The night we were there the service was spot on. We did have multiple servers come to our table but for the most part we had a main waiter who was cordial, unobtrusive, yet attentive. Our dinners took time but we were informed of the progress.Lobster Bisque creamy and subtle. Cod, clams and chorizo worked for me as the spicy sausage was a nice foil to the delicate fish.

Easily one of the best restaurants in town. They also have one of the best deals in town -  $15 prix fix 3-course dinner (must be seated betw. 5-5:30pm i think). I had dinner at the bar, right next to a roaring fireplace. The decor is awesome - very nice and cozy. So - my final bill came to $23 - here's what i ordered: Glass of red wine (Pinot Noir, excellent) - paid $8 extra for it.Creamy polenta appetizer (silky, smooth, really delicious, as good as it gets) Roast Chicken w/ Wild Rice (christ almighty...this was perfect...great sauce, perfect rice, juicy chicken) Key Lime Pie (great). All for $23...ok, so with tip, it came to $29. But still.....this was fine dining, in a terrific atmosphere, plenty of food, great service, a real treat.

My boyfriend and I came here for a quiet Wednesday night birthday dinner. The restaurant is in a charming and welcoming old home. Service was very good. I had the beet salad to start which was delicious. I don't usually like fennel but the way this was prepared really added to the salad and I ate it all! He had the arugula salad which he also enjoyed. For mains I had the duck breast and he had the bass. The duck break was perfectly cooked. Very flavorful and juicy with some nice crispy skin. Mustard greens were also very prepared. He also really liked his bass. I didn't taste it because I was so happy with my food :-)  They were also kind enough to bring us a side of the lobster mashed potatoes.  They were so creamy with just the right amount of lobster! The key lime pie for dessert for very rich and probably the best key lime pie I have ever had. We will definitely be coming back! I also noticed some nice private rooms which could be reserved for family style seating with large groups.

Came for saturday brunch and was very pleasantly surprised! The food was yummy, the service was so polite and so accomodating and the restaurant itself was so cute and pretty inside. will definitely be coming back!

I had a late dinner here after reading good reviews on Yelp.  My friend and I showed up as they were about to close and they were kind enough to seat us anyway.  We had just arrived from traveling all day and were very hungry , so we were grateful.  We had the gnocchi  as an appetizer--- perfect, fantastic!!  My entree was the salmon which was equally wonderful and cooked perfectly.  I loved the wild rice that was served with it.  My friend had the cod which she ate every bite of.  Service was very friendly and efficient.  I forgot to mention the rolls and butter-- so so good.  Atmosphere was cozy and calm.  Definitely would return

I LOVE Amanda's!!!  Been here for breakfast, brunch (many times) and dinner(also many times). Every experience has been great. Staff if very profesional (despite how busy they are) and very friendly. Sure the bill can get a bit pricey but honestly, you get what you pay for; Excellent quality! Don't be afraid to choose something that sounds a bit "off" from the menu, trust me, they know what they're doing. And if you don't end up liking a certain part or which to replace an ingredient, they make no fuss. Go! Go! Go! Eat! Eat! Eat! ( good luck finding parking!)

So here is my update and indeed I remain a fan.  I would love to split that fifth Yelp star, but I can not.  I went for Restaurant Week 2010 and the food was great, but my main dish was soooo small.  The appetizer, off the Restaurant Week menu, was portioned very nicely, so I am left asking if the Restaurant Week menu was intentionally smaller portion.  We'll never know.Wine is great.  I love great wine.  Atmosphere is excellent.  I drove there and was able to park for free a few blocks away in a parking garage.  It's a great place!
Pan seared chicken was delicious!!! Great service and suggestions from our waitress Mary!
yummy food, wish they had a bigger brunch menu. delish mimosas! cute small brunch spot, friendly staff.

One of my favorite brunch spots in Hoboken! Reminds me of a French brasserie in Paris from decor to the uniform of the waiters and bartender. The  poached eggs with crab hash is awesome! Gnocchi is delish. Definitely a must-try if you're in Hoboken looking for brunch!

I've had my fair share of Hoboken restaurants. This place, by far, has topped all of them. I've been there twice, once for dinner and another time for brunch. The dinner was phenomenal. Softshell crab for an appetizer, lamb chops for my main course, and keylime pie for dessert. There menu is seasonal, so you're pretty much guaranteed fresh ingredients and something new every time. Not you're run of the mill restaurant serving the same dishes over and over again.I've never had softshell crab before, but this is the place to try it for the first time. Very tasty, no chewy like i was afraid it would be.I was taken aback by the lambchops! Cooked to perfection, and the sauce I wanted to lick off the plate. The keylime pie! It is made from scratch, none of the premade crust here(or green food dye) Comparable to what one would get from Florida. Filling was the right consistency, lime wasn't overpowering but tart enough, and the crust was crumbly goodness. Brunch was good. I'm not going to rave about it, but it was a refreshing menu as well. I had the poached eggs, but when i was saw the eggs Benedict I was quickly in remorse wishing i had that instead.Overall go to Amandas. It may be a splurge depending on your budget. However, many more Hoboken restaurants charge so much more for slop. You will not be disappointed.

Extremely overrated. Went there for brunch. Very disappointed with very limited menu. They told us they ran out of bread. How do you run out of bread on a Sunday for brunch? Food was fine but overhyped and overpriced for bacon and eggs.
Excellent service, food, pace of meal.  Kind staff overall.  Look forward to my next visit!

boyfriend and I came here for dinner.  the atmosphere- felt like you were in a house- very homey. even the dishes that were on the table when we sat down were mismatched. food was good...i would say like 7/10- nothing mind blowing but we enjoyed it.  it was a really relaxing dinner and we had a nice time :)

Quite possibly the best restaurant in Hoboken! Everything is delicious. I have been twice in the past few months and have not been disappointed. Would highly recommend this place for entertaining friends and family...that you like!

Had my daughter's baby shower here recently. Everything was wonderful from soup to nuts. The management and the service was impeccable. The food and drinks amazing. We had the Sunday brunch for 30 people and I could not have asked for more.

We kicked off the New Year by trying a new restaurant ( for us ) for Brunch and we were not disappointed.  We appreciated a very warm greeting by the Host who seems to have perfected the exact amount of time to spend and tone to bring to a short welcoming conversation as you settled into your table.  The environment is very warm and cozy and romantic in the section we were seated in beyond the bar.  I learned while looking around the restaurant that there is a much larger and still charming area within other sections of this restaurant.  There is also a small private area on the first floor and a private room downstairs.  The brunch menu was strong and we both enjoyed our meals ( eggs in purgatory & eggs with short ribs hash). The service was very attentive while it remained a private dining experience.  Thank you Amanda's for a good first meal of 2016.   We drove from Central NJ - felt it was worth it & we will return.
Great place to have an event!  Had a small baby shower in their downstairs room.  Food was amazing, service was super and the room was perfect and cute - thanks Amanda's!

You feel like you went back in time coming into this place. Early 1900s time wise? I dont really know, it just looks old, like living in an old rural italian village thats for sure. My girl brought me here for our anniversary while she was going to Stevens Institute of Technology.  With her knowing that I love desserts, she brought me here.  Place is pretty romantic actually.  Bring your significant other here if you want her/him to feel special!Start off with Entrees:  I myself had some type of grilled steak with baked potatoes.  Well Done steak for me!  I enjoyed it!  My girl had some type of seafood, I dont really remember what she had, I think some type of shrimp dish.Drinks:  We had a nice red italian wine!  Magnifico!Service:  They were attentive enough!  They were not the fastest, but they were not slow either.  So I give them 4 stars for that!Dessert:  This is the only dessert that you should have when you go here, otherwise you will only be wasting your time haha.  Creme Brulee is the dessert of the night everynight baby!  It was soo good, I had two of them.  Actually I had two and a half!  I ate my girl's creme brulee because she was too full to eat.  Her loss!  Enjoy your time here!  We did!

I went to this place 3 days ago. It was my second time there. It was a very good experience. I would like to add that the last time i went there was about 5 years ago, and i noticed that this time around the menu was still the same, which i find to be great. It means that things are working out with this menu.I ended up having the same thing i had 5 years prior. Steamed mussels for app. and grilled angus steak with blue cheese potatoes. Still good just like last time. The atmosphere is great, well decorated, cozy, dim lit.  Service was ok,  it did the job, but the server was very evasive and was never to be found. Wine bottles are average price, but single glasses are expensive, so definetely get a bottle.

I "Yelped" this place and hit gold! I'm a new Hoboken resident and I wanted to stay local for dinner. My date traveled from Edgewater by car so I wanted a place with Parking (which is ALWAYS spotty at best in Hoboken) - Amanda's didn't offer Parking but they offered validation for a lot that is 5 blocks away... not bad. Amanda's was a bit "upscale" in terms of service... and what I mean by that is that they truly make an effort at making sure that you're taken care of and satisfied.... and they succeed!The service was excellent. Our waiter, the host, everyone was great... very attentive, yet not overbearing. The food was really good. So far the best I've had in Hoboken; yet the prices were really not over the top (for the quality and service).Bottom line: if you want a nice, QUIET (yes, you can actually whisper that your date looks lovely, and she won't say "could you repeat that?...") dinner with excellent service and very well prepared and presented food for an average of about $120.00 for 2 (with a bottle of wine from their "recession proof list"), then this is the place to go!I highly recommend it and will be back!

Elegant and beautiful restaurant with green view on the back but the food is average. I came here 3 times, always spacial occasions, baby shower, birthday party... It's very pretty and charming place for the party but the food is average and not so memorable.

Lovely decor.  Showed up at around 3 today.  Ordered the club sandwich, which was a huge portion. Nice spin on a classic with ciabatta bread and avocado.  Server forgot my beer, so only four stars instead of five.  Would definitely go back again, though.

We really wanted to enjoy Amanda's.  We read a bunch of reviews, noted that it was very high up on folks' lists of best brunch places in Hoboken, and headed out expecting a very pleasurable meal.  The atmosphere was pretty good; and the decor is cute.  We liked the mix-and-matched plates and coffee cups (as opposed to the standardized restaurantware that most places have).  The host was warm and friendly, and our waitress was attentive and kind.  The food, however, was not as good as the service and decor.  The Balthazar bread basket was disappointing.  We love Balthazars, but this basket was just not that fresh.  Something was amiss.  The crispy eggs were bland, and sorta rubbery.  The warm mushroom and goat cheese salad was just average.  The mushroom was chopped into small pieces (too small) and not that flavorful.  We ordered a side of bacon after seeing nice pieces of thick-cut bacon at other groups' tables.  They brought us a completely burned plate of bacon.  Totally charred beyond acceptability.  We asked our waitress for a non-burned plate of bacon; and she said no problem and took it back. The bacon that she brought back was cooked all right, but it was covered with still-bubbling grease; and when I picked up a piece of bacon, grease was dripping off it.  They should've soaked up the grease with a paper towel or something, right?  The shoestring potatoes were pretty good.All in all, I think the kitchen probably didn't have a good day.  We'd like to try this place again.

Sitting up front is quite nice if you're into wine and cheese, it's a quaint place this Amanda's.  I believe the same owners of another place in town?Amanda's has a decent wine list and some pretty good dinner entree's- my Mom was in town, so the wife, me and good ol' Mom stopped in for dinner.  They loved their dinners, mine was OK (I ordered the steak...note:  I'm a huge filet mignon fan...especially bone in!...unfortunately at Amanda's they only have another cut of meat which is a bit tough ).  All in all, apps, dinner, dessert, coffee- was a great time.I wish there were more seemingly intimate restaurants in Hoboken (we are still searching as we moved here a few months ago from Chicago)

I took my mom here for brunch for her birthday. We were running late for our reservation and I called to let them know and they said no problem & they pushed our reservation back and hour. They had a nice brunch menu, food was delicious and the service was great. We both loved the atmosphere and decor. Very cozy, yet intimate and luxurious feeling. Will definitely go back for brunch and try dinner as well.

I've been to Amanda's twice and have had good experiences. The crispy eggs are great along with their mimosas. I was able to try the ginger Creme Brule which was the perfect amount of ginger. The setting is very cute, almost like a bed and breakfast. I'll definitely be visiting Amanda's again.

As a restaurant Amanda's has an aesthetically pleasing interior which is ideal for more intimate occasions.  I went with a friend to try the 'prixe-fixe' early dinner menu, which consisted of a choice of a soup or salad, bread, choice of three entrees, and a choice of two deserts.  Although the place was relatively quite, service was prompt and the staff friendly and helpful.While the menu offerings certainly trend towards more formal cuisine, the actual quality is lagging.  I found the salad overwhelmed with cheese and raisins and the greens too bitter.  More importantly, the pork loin entree was very inconsistent in the doneness of the meat; parts were pleasantly pink, whereas other slices were clearly overdone.  The sweet potato hash appeared chaotic, had a burnt taste and carelessly plated.  The key lime pie, while visually appealing (a nice slice of lime on top), lacked a lime taste and had a weak crust.Overall a good value at $14/person, but a cup of coffee is $2.50, and a soda is around the same.While I'd recommend Amandas's for a more special occasion, this recommendation is based more for the service and ambiance and less for the actual food.
Great food, charming decor, impeccable service...Amanda's is a class act.  I love going for dinner but their brunch is not to be missed.
Interesting place - classy and romantic-ish, yet not pretentious.The food is good but the menu is getting a bit old.

I really like this place. The ambiance was very calm and relaxing. While the decor resembled an a beautiful well kept house. The food was excellent, I had the flounder which was mixed with potatoes and it was amazing. I am definitely going back. Though it was a little pricey it was well worth it.

My girlfriend and I were wandering about Hoboken Saturday (11/8) evening when we saw Amandas. We decided to give it a try. Well, sometimes, randomness pays off. Not only did they have a table, but the food was outstanding - especially the truffle pasta. Love the atmosphere, too. It was quite busy but felt comfortable, warm, and cozy.
great tapas, atmosphere is perfect for groups and or a couple to talk and be able to see one another :) good location in the upper west side of NYC. highly recommended.

If it is Saturday afternoon, you're in Hoboken, you're hungry, and you're in a mood for a quite brunch, go here and enjoy!The restaurant is quaintly decorated and spacious.  The service was very attentive.  The food was plated nicely, correctly cooked, and seasoned well.

The atmosphere is great here! I loved the charm.. very Hoboken meets Paris meeets... eggs? I did like the service... I never had my water glass less than half empty... attentive staff, great menu... there is DEFINITELY something you would be compelled to pick... I debated on three items (as typical of me)... and ended up with the frittata with mozz, eggplant and tomatoes... I must say, I'm a good cook and I've done frittatas on a lazy day that have come out similar... I just didn't get the seasoning (since they chose to put very little...) the side potatoes were a great add-in and the fruit on the plate made the meal end off on a great end note...I wish I ordered their Assorted Breads from a bakery in NY, it looked DELISH but we were only 3 people and 8 pieces of bread and my mom and I on a low-carb diet wouldn't have made sense.. My mother's mushroom and vegg omelet was very sophisticated, in that it was julliened veggies and small cut mushrooms that were sell-seasoned... I liked the poach eggs that my husband ordered with crab hash that didn't have an overwhelming crab flavor...The funny thing about this restaurant is that EVEN though my meal wasn't spectacular... when I'm in Weehawken, I will trek 5 minutes into Amanda's FOR SURE, take a friend, wow them with the ambiance and order the croissant french toast with a fruit compote -- and I'll probably be happy... you cant go wrong with fruit and the ambiance this place has.. I guess I just got picky with the frittata because I like making them myself-- if management is reading, a pinch of added flavor is all it really needs! Love the place though and will be back!
Met some friends for a birthday dinner at Amanda's - we had such a good meal. Great wine list, great atmosphere and the Grilled Double Cut Pork Chop was fantastic.
I highly recommend their early meal deal. For $28 you get dinner for two for one of the best places in Hoboken. Just be warned: parking is a challenge.

Went to Amanda's on my husband's birthday.  The ambiance was lovely, and the place was quiet enough that we could talk comfortably.  Waitstaff was great.  We were both delighted with our food choices.  I was worried because I am vegetarian and there was only one main dish choice that I would be able to eat.  However, they were willing to make one of the other dishes a main course, and I ended up taking their pasta anyway.  It was delicious.  Our desserts were great -- key lime pie for me, molten chocolate for my husband.  Dessert came with a blazing candle and a birthday greeting written in chocolate.  Wine was also perfect.  All in all it was just what one hopes for in a special evening's restaurant outing.

I went to Amanda's for a early afternoon brunch with my gal pal.  I was expecting it to be packed at 12pm, but there was plenty of seating.  Roll out of bed and shake off your Saturday night stupor by noon and your might beat the crowd too.The food was good but didn't make me swoon.  I was expecting a more exciting brunch menu but it was pretty basic.  Nonetheless, the decor and ambiance of the restaurant is cute and classy.Will post an update after I eventually go back to try to the early-bird dinner special.

Very pretty place inside and attentive help most of the time.  I must say I wish they had more on the menu for a picky guy like me.  I have had a few of their salads (beet, watercress & mixed greens) and they are always good.  As for entrees, I have had the short ribs, chicken, sirloin and the shrimp dishes and all were good.  Overall, good food and ambiance.  The wine list could use a bit of help as well, but then I lived near Napa for 7 years.  I like this place and Anthony David's in all of Hoboken for ambiance and food with Anthony David's a bit higher than Amanda's.

I've always been a big fan of Amanda's and usually go for their delicious brunch (reservations highly recommended!).   I hadn't been for dinner in quite some time, but went last night with some friends.The atmosphere and the food were both terrific.  Amanda's was beautifully decorated for the holidays and they had the fire place going.   The food was delicious and it was nice to see that they also offered 'recession wines' -- adding more moderately priced wines to their wine list.Our only complaint was the service -- it was unbelievably slow.  Our dinner took close to 3 hours for 3 courses.   Appetizers came out at a good pace, but the time between appetizers and main course was lengthy -- I think because our waitress wasn't keeping an eye on us to know that we were ready for the next course.  When we finally ordered dessert, the coffee came out quickly, but again, the time until the dessert came out dragged on.   And once we were done, we waited probably another 10-15 minutes for the waitress to bring the check.  Now, we were having a great time catching up and weren't on a set time schedule, however Amanda's only validates parking for 3 hours and we had to 'buy' another hour for $5 because the meal took so long (the waitress was kind enough to sell us the hour there instead of us paying $20 for parking at the garage!).   Overall, great atmosphere and food.   I'm hoping the service melt down was because of our one waitress and not an ongoing problem at Amanda's.  BTW - think you definitely want reservations for weekend dinners.

I love Amanda's.  We've been here 3 times already, and each dining experience has been a good one.  The last visit was brunch, and both the poached eggs and crab hash, and vegetable omelette were very good.  Of course, we had to start out with their Bloody Marys - which were very good as well.  The ambience there, shall i say, is 'classy, homely' - kind of like the dining area of an elegant bed-and-breakfast.  Lastly, the wait staff there were very attentive.  Although the overall review of Amanda's was that it's 'not good for kids', we had brought our 3-year old toddler with us for brunch, and they were very accommodating to him.  Another big plus as to why we love Amanda's.

Fantastic !!  The best restaurant in Hoboken.  As a regular Hobo I try to experience Amanda's as often as possible. Recently had both halves of the family for Holiday dinners and couldn't have been more pleased.

What a wonderful discovery! I suspect however that Amanda's is not so much a restaurant that needs discovering. If I am the last to know about this awesome place I wouldn't be surprised. I am not from the area but wanted to celebrate a special occasion with my family while in Hoboken. I found Amanda's here on Yelp and went for dinner.  A lovely looking restaurant with a touch of Victorian charm and a thoroughly contemporary menu. They have a solid wine list with a number of good values. We picked a Matanzas Creek Chardonnay and it was great. We had the Gnocchi and the Mussels to start. The gnocchi was pillowy goodness with a nice pea and mushroom sauté. The mussels were abundant and delicious with a really good stock and some delicious focaccia. We had Scallops, Trout and the Lamb Chops. All were perfectly prepared and delicious. We shared a piece of the key lime tart for dessert. It was delicious and fresh with a bright sweet limeyness that was just right! The coffee was  great too.  The service was sharp, friendly and not smothering.  This is going to become a regular stop for me over the next 4 years when I come to visit my daughter at Stevens. Hello Hoboken and Hello Amanda's!
The $15 meals are a steal. We thought the food was quick nice; prepared with care. And the service was good.

The moment you walk in, you feel like you're in a European cafe on a crisp Fall day. The staff is courteous, respectful and always accommodating. Coffee is dark and flavorful. Mimosas are flowing. Smoked salmon eggs benny are the shit and the crispy eggs are a close second. Mismatched plates, old-style decor and bread basket from Balthazar. My absolute favorite brunch place in the entire world.

This was our second time at Amanda's for brunch and it was even better than the first which surprising.   It was both my husbands b'day and our friends.
