Service was friendly, warm and effiecent but not overbearing.  Food was fresh and had a home cooked yet professional feel to it.  We all felt slightly hung over so to be pampered and fed was perfect. They even brought us 2 desserts with b'day candles in on the house!!  One was key lime pie which was delicious but quite tart and the other was N.Y cheese cake which was heaven on a plate!  We all had to be rolled out of there!

One of my favorite spots for Brunch in Hoboken - They know how to really pouch a good egg.  The eggs benny is on point! Service is amazing and the atmosphere makes you feel like your in the south.  I love this place - I havent eaten here for anything other than brunch but I am such it would be fantastic

Yes you read right. I gave one of the supposed best restaurants in Hoboken 3 stars. I know that amandas has a very popular brunch (the best in the city according to them) which I have never had so I'm sticking to dinner in this review. I was just there last night and had such a mediocre experience I felt the need to share immediately. Amandas has an early seating menu mon-sat if you make a reservation at 5 or 530. It's a prix fix menu for $15 a person and you can get a bottle of their house wine for $20. Now I always give credit where credit is due so I'll be the first to admit that that's a great deal. So when we went last night we did the early seating and from the second we walked in, I could sense a bit of an attitude on the servers. Which to an extent I can understand since they are not making nearly as much money off of the early seating customers as they would for normal dinner patrons. But it's pretty unacceptable to act like your customers are ruining your life.  And it nearly ruined our dinner. Our server seemed annoyed in general and wasn't the slightest bit friendly. And not once did the guys who brought our food say your welcome when I thanked them (personal pet peeve of mine) On to the food. The chicken and rice soup i ordered was pretty skimpy in portion and the soup barely covered the bottom of the bowl. The skirt steak was better, precisely cooked to order and went well w the mashed potatoes. So if I was ratinkg just the food alone I would've thrown another star in there, mostly bc I know the food at amandas is good and I was pretty satisfied w my dinner. But a-ok food this particular night in combination w the lousy service made for a subpar experienceI wouldn't not recommend this restaurant by any stretch. I want to go back for it's brunch or a non first seating dinner. Maybe the servers won't made me feel like I should apologize to them for existing
A pleasant ambience, an average staff and an average food.  Overall B-.Think, for Hoboken standard and this price, one could do a LOT better.

Every bit of our meal was fantastic - the apps, the entree and the desert. The new chef here is amazing! Best gnocchi I've EVER had, hands down! And the service was great as well, our waiters were very attentive. Best restaurant in Hoboken if you ask me - and that speaks volumes with the amount of great places in town.

This was one of the worst meals I have ever eaten. It was restaurant week in NY this week and we tried their set menu for $36 aprox. I ordered Polenta to begin with and it was rubbery and then the roast chicken entree arrived cold and tasted very strange. I didn't eat it, leaving it deliberately on one side of my plate, hoping one of the waiters would notice my disgust. It finally happened and once my concerns had been related to management, a nice gentleman arrived with an offer to half my bill, not comp it, but half it! I was in no mood to argue and agreed. Desert, Key Lime Pie, then arrived and it was bland and gooey. I would rate this as one of the worst meals ever, and would never entertain going back to this place again. It was also very noisy and very over priced for the quality of food on offer.

Last minute decision to celebrate 3rd year anniversary here before the "real" thing at Eleven Madison Park on Saturday.  I really want to like this place but was a bit disappointed because I was expecting so much more because of yelp reviews. The service is subpar: everyone makes mistakes but the place was empty and the server brought a wine to the table that we didn't order,  she keeps on reaching her arms across the table instead of going to the other side (but I guess I'm watching too much Downton Abbey), she asked for orders and I stated the appetizers we wanted and she CUT ME OFF and said that's she's asking for the drink orders, who does that?! Oh I also mentioned that we're celebrating and they didn't put cute stuff greeting on our Domino's looking molten lava cake dessert (little details people!) So the food: I had better canned soup, scallops were a bit overcooked. Husband loved his steak and the only star for the night is the creamy polenta.

I'll start by saying that I'm glad I wasn't the one paying. Amanda's wasn't BAD or anything. I went with a group of 9 after the Stevens graduation earlier that day. The restaurant was smart enough to make a special post-graduation menu following their early dinner model, so in terms of food quantity for price I can't complain. But quality? Eh. Granted, I come from the limited vegetarian point of view, but nothing I ate really stood out or warranted the "wow" that Amanda's seems to get from so many others. Decor isn't terribly important to me but for all the oohs and aahs over the ambiance I wasn't all that pleased.A huge kudos must be given to the management for their handling of post-graduation festivities. Each graduate's dessert plate had "Congratulations (Name)" written in chocolate sauce, and each received a bottle of champagne. A very nice gesture indeed, and one that despite my tepid experience might cause me to return for private events.

Delicious and elegant! I came here for brunch several times and so far I'm a big fan of all the dishes Ive tried. Food is always fresh and yum! The wait staff can be alittle stiff but they are attentive.  Went here recently for a special occasion with 6 others and they gave us a private room that was cozy and pleasant.  Cant wait to try their dinner menu!

One of my favorite places in Hoboken. Great atmosphere and nice, quality food, which unfortunately is hard to find in Hoboken. Good wine list and great service. They do change their menu frequently, though so sometimes you may feel limited in what to order, but overall very good. Nice rooms for private events w/ no room fee, but you do need a guaranteed min or people.
A great Hoboken bistro with reliably good food and a comfortable, upscale but not pretentious feel. Good for a date night.
One of only a few "go-to" restaurants in Hoboken for great food every time and unique atmosphere. Perfect "Date" location for dinner and drinks.

Great food. Got lucky with an open table...so make reservations in advance! The polenta with raisins is amazing.  The poached eggs are perfect. I had them accompanied with crab hash which was not overdone and really tasty. 5 dishes between three of us with 4 drinks and coffee=$100...not bad at all!

I used to live in Hoboken a few years ago. Amanda's was THE place for brunch and special occasions. The decor is that of a classy, feminine tea salon. My favorite touch is the antique plates they use for the place settings. They remove them as soon as your food comes out. I always thought the ballroom would be great for a bridal shower or baby shower. Luckily, the opportunity arose where I could throw one there this past week-end.We threw a baby shower brunch for my sister in law on Sunday . The ballroom is the most appropriate space for an event because it is out of the way of the rest of the restaurant and can be sectioned off with a curtain. Between the wait staff and the event coordinator Dana, the service could not have been better. We were given an ample amount of time in the room for our event 11-3:30 and I think paid a pretty modest price, comparative to what I was finding in Manhattan.I hear that this is "shower central" in Hoboken... and now I can see why.
Delicious food. Wonderful ambiance in a great town.  Went the extra step to make our 16 year wedding anniversary special.

First time dining at Amanda's...Delightful and delectable, beautifully decorated. The service was top notch and the food was fabulous. Highly recommend making a trip to Hoboken for a wonderful dining experience.

Some say that Amanda's Amanda's is one of the most romantic and classy restaurants in New Jersey. I dare say that it is one of the best anywhere.  It is unassumingly located on Washington Street in Hoboken. When you walk in, you feel like you're in a restaurant from the days of Sinatra. The dining room has a cozy townhouse feel to it.  White clothed tables are set perfectly with each diner getting their very on unique dinner plate. I don't think any two plates in the place are the same. Everyone from the maitre d' to the waiters and bus boys are in bow ties. Service was very attentive yet unintrusive.  The food was very good.  I had the skirt steak with chimmichurri sauce, whipped potatoes and roasted carrots. It was delicious. Steak was done perfectly and plenty flavorful adn juicy. My date had the seafood stew in a tomato broth. It was a big bowl of stew, though we wished it packed more of the mussels, clams and fish to make it more hearty. Meal was capped off with the yummy chocolate molten cake and vanilla ice cream. The chocolate cake was pretty much a souffle so it took a while to come out. There is a great selection of very affordable wines. We had a bottle of the Albet i Noya, a Spanish white wine. What was left over in the wine bottle, they packed for us in a small wine bag to take home! They validate 3 hours of parking at Little Man Parking on 12th and Hudson. Just remember to get a sticker before you leave.Overall, it was great dining experience. One thing that I did find interesting besides everyone wearing bow ties was that there was NO Mexicans there. Not even the busboys were Mexican. Maybe they were in the kitchen, but I have never been to a non Chinese restaurant that didn't have a Mexican worker. Didn't affect anything, just saying...

AMAZING truffle and pea risotto.  Portion was perfect as risotto is so creamy, and the flavors were outstanding with the mushrooms.  Boyfriend had the calamari which was so delicate and not greasy or fried so very light.Salmon with ratatouille was perfectly cooked, the veggies and pesto complimented the lemon cream sauce on top.  Was just perfect.  Boyfriend had short rib ravioli which was a little dry but mushroom sauce was divine.  For dessert we split a molten chocolate lava cake which was perfetly moist on the inside, but with a slight crunch on the ouside. Amazing.2 reasons not giving it 5 stars:  Came here in November and had the scallops and was disappointed, flavors were bland.  But more annoying is the waitstaff.  There was no host to greet us and there isn't really even a host station.  Both times I've been here we had to awkwardly search for a host. Waitstaff has 0 personality and doesn't really know the menu.  We asked if the restaurant week portions were any different from the regular meals and never received an answer, only weird mumbling.  They don't have any explanations and just have an awkward table manner in general.  However this did not at all make the experience unenjoyable as the ambiance is lovely and food is delectable.

I would actually give it 4.5 stars...Everything was so amazing except for one thing so I feel like I can't quite give it the 5...Pros- Ambiance and decor are amazing..just like what others have said, the old 1800's restored brownstone..its very quaint inside, nice chandeliers and the silverware is very nice stuff (not like id know the difference, but I am guessing they didn't buy it at walmartService - Very good service..nothing really that stands out, but thats a good thing..Just high quality service without being overbearingPrice - I was so suprised because I have always wanted to come here for a special occasion and figured it would be a $250-$300 meal for two.  The prices are so reasonable for this caliber restaurant (125 for a couple w/t&t) and they have an entire wine list of bottles less than $30..we had sav blanc from NZ which was a great choiceFood - Bread was hot and very good, like something from a european cafe..for app we had the pea risotto, which was just awesome..you have to have it...entrees were the salmon (fantastic) and the sirloin..here is the only reason it's not quite 5 star...the sirloin was very good, but just not excellent..i know it's not a steakhouse but i ordered medium and prob should have went medium rare..it was a lil overcooked and not quite cooked evenly throughout..it wasnt super tender but the outside was charred nicely...flavor was good but not amazing..the potato it came with was great..Ill prob try something else next time, but i would still get the steak, just med rare..Dessert - the apple cake....fanF'ntasticSo overall i loved Amandas and it is a great restaurant for a special occassion, date, kinda thing..Not so much a place I would come to with another dude...I will def be coming back...I also want to try the brunch

It's good if you like bird food.  Big plate, small food.  It's good for women who don't really like to eat.  You know, the type that sit there and poke at their food for a bit before either sending it back or wrapping it up to take home only to throw away later.  Much better options in Hoboken. I don't see what all the fuss is about.

We came here for New Year's Eve and, even on such a busy night, the food was top notch. The dinner was a little on the expensive side, but was on par with what other areas were charging for a New Year's Eve prix fixe. Everything was just amazing. I had a butternut squash risotto which was nice and creamy. That was followed by roast pork which was cooked perfectly. All of that was topped off with key lime pie, which was exactly how key lime pie should be - not too sweet.Needless to say, we were so pleased that we made reservations for Valentines Day as well.

Attended a small private party here.  Very lovely location and perfect for a small event.  The service was attentive but we got an odd vibe from the waitress, who seemed a little annoyed all day.  Could have been because we wanted to greet the guest of honor before checking our coats and ordering coffee, so the waitress had to wait for us for a few minutes.  I appreciate the attempt at prompt service, but she should have been able to recognize the social cue.  If they wanted us to check our coats, shouldn't they have asked us to do that when we passed the coat check on the way in?The food was pretty good and the party menu had a nice variety.  One particularly atrocious point of service happened when we asked to get our parking ticket validated.  Long story, but we had to go back to do it.  My friend popped in and asked someone for 2 stamps, at the request of the garage.  The person she asked- and I don't know who it was because I wasn't there- actually asked her for $5.  Yes, that's right, the restaurant asked her to pay for validated parking.  I assume it's because they probably only wanted to give us 1 stamp, not 2.  However, if the restaurant knows that we just attended a 3 hour party, and I assume the hosts paid for all 3 hours, then what in the world was the reason to ask us for more money?  Had I actually been there when this request was made, I never would have let her pay.  I guess they're lucky I was in the car!  Just very, very odd and kind of grubby.I don't live nearby, so I won't have a reason to go back.

My girlfriend and I wanted to try this place for some time and finally had got to try it. The atmosphere proved to be classy and elegant. We found ourselves whispering due to the fact that the entire restaurant was so quite. It might have been the time that we went and the the amount of people that were dinning at the time but I can't see it being any noisier. The food was delicious and reasonably priced for a classy place. I found the portions to be small since I was still hungry after the appetizer, entree, and dessert. A few of the staff members including the waitress were a little unpleasant, not to the point of rude, just noticeably unpleasant. I would consider dining here again in the future.
went here on a Friday night nd  was so pleasently surprised

Amanda's is one of my favorite restaurants in Hoboken - having lived there for a few years, I tried a ton of places and this one is near the top. Beautifully prepared food, VERY friendly wait staff and amazing ambiance. What some people don't know is that you can have a 3-course prix fixe dinner (with several choices straight off the main dinner menu) for $14 a person - you heard me correct - it's the culinary deal of the decade - only thing is you must be seated and order before 5:45 pm (even on the weekends they have this deal). It's a great pre-theatre option before heading into the city.

food was good, service was terrible. Forgot 2 of the 4 appetizers ordered, until we asked about them. Forgot a drink order. Brought out entrees before the appetizers were finished. The server didn't even check on the meal. Disappointing as the food was good, but the service was not.
Fun. Interesting menu. Knowledgeable servers. Love the value wine list.

I have been to Amanda's twice for brunch, and I love it.  From the outside it looks like any other restaurant, but step inside and be transported to an old world townhouse.  There is a small bar, various little rooms with windows looking out on either Washington St. or a backyard garden.  The food is very fresh and delicious.  I had an egg white omelet both times and was very happy with it.  I was even able to substitute a side salad for the roasted potatoes (which are delicious, but a foodie has to pick and choose her battles sometimes).  Downstairs are a lovely wine cellar and cozy party room complete with fireplace.  The atmosphere is quaint and the food is delicious.  I highly recommend it!

Worth a return visit. One of the nicer restaurants I've been to in Hoboken. Nice date spot. Homey (located in a former home with original nook and cranny layout) yet formal atmosphere, friendly service, nice food

Amandas is my favorite restaurant in Hoboken, It may not be New York City, but the food is excellent and the feeling is of a bed and breakfast. It's a romantic restaurant with excellent service. I think the bar while small is qute beautiful.It's also the place where I proposed to my wife. So it will always be special in our hearts.

After our disastrous first attempt at brunch/lunch on New Year's Day at a cute coffee house, we wandered north on Washington forever until Amanda's saves us! Wasn't too busy so we had no resistance getting a table with our preschoolers where they might not always be so welcome. The food, ambience and service were superb. Polenta starter, killer French toast and smoked salmon/eggs benedict were all unreal, and the Belgian beer was so good I'm embarrassed to have forgotten the name. Can't wait to go with my wife for a date night.

Amanda's is one of my favorite restaurants! I moved from the Hoboken area 8 years ago and still come back just to eat here. I was finally able to get back to the area this Sunday and of course grabbed dinner at Amanda's. When I made the reservation on opentable I noted that my friend was leaving for Australia the following day. When we ordered dessert, they surprised her by writing "Bon Voyage" on the plate in chocolate! Its the attention to small details that makes Amanda's a 5-star restaurant.
BRUNCH: It was good but forgettable. Nothing to drive out of your way for. The quaint decor and good service was commendable, but it really shouldn't outshine the food as it did.

Can I deduct a star just for location? =) Hoboken, NJ? C'mon! Alright, alright I won't. The food is too delicious.Amanda's Restaurant is a quaint looking restaurant along the main street of Hoboken, NJ. It apparently is very well-known for it's brunch (which I have yet to try) but the dinner was quite impressive. The inside looks like tea time with grandma and has the feeling of a B&B. I liked that. Cosy. I'd definitely recommend it for a date in the 'boken. Service was great though the seats are just too close to each other. We had the shrimp wrapped in phyllo as an appetizer and I enjoyed the turkey, bacon, duck roulade while my bf had the steak. The roulade was DELICIOUS. So rich. I think I heard an artery pop. Unfortunately it doesn't seem to be on their menu anymore last time I checked. Give this place a spin.

the first time i went to amanda's, i fell in love.  the food was delicious, company was great, service was fantastic and the restaurant was really cute.  i went back this past sunday because i've been meaning to bring my mom.  at the end of the day, there's nothing particularly oustanding about the food... but the service is very friendly and the place is cute.  oh, did i mention you get free validation for 3 hours at a nearby lot?  yes... this is key in parking-sucks-hoboken.anyway, on my most recent visit, i ordered my brunch go-to:  eggs benedict.  it was decent.  (i think i've had better eggs benedict at the pancake house)  i ordered this last time and it was better...my mom had the poached eggs and crab hash.  by far the best plate from what we ordered.  it was tasty last time and it was even tastier this past sunday.the garden omlette/side of bacon we ordered was just mediocre.  and the bread basket either was not all that fresh or balthazar's breads are not that tasty.  i think it was the former.  won't waste money on the bread basket again.  i love bread, but nothing about it seems worth the money.haha.  hmm.  as i'm writing this, i'm wondering why i'm giving this place 4 stars.  maybe it's a 3.5.  i rounded up because of the free parking, the yummy crab hash, friendly service and cute decor!  i'll be back!

My family had dinner here last week for my niece's birthday and we loved it. It was a quiet night, but the service was attentive without being too fussy and the food was quite good. Two of us had the black mussels which were fresh and all eaten; I personally like a white wine garlic broth, but this was fine and the foccacia served with it was delicious. we loved the warm bread and the butter was room temp, not a frozen chunk. Desserts (we tried 4) were DELICIOUS and they served the warm lava cake to the birthday girl with her name drizzled  in chocolate sauce on the plate. the owner came over to chat and the waiter walked my elderly mother out to the car in the pouring rain. All in all, a very nice experience and we would go back. Perfect for  family meeting place.
So far the best restaurant I have been to in Hoboken. It is classy, they make great drinks and they have a quality wine list. Highly recommend for a date. Everything we had was excellent.

I love love love this place.   Every single meal we've had here is delicious and inventive,  service is impeccable,  and the atmosphere is cozy.   Dinner is great, and also their brunch is just as amazing too.  We've been coming here for over 5 years, and it consistently is top notch.   Great wine list too.

The place is cute, I'll give it that.  Charming and refined in an English Victorian style.  It is very ooh-la-la upon entering in an understanding elegant sort of way.  My husband, aunt, and myself went here for Sunday Brunch.  The three of us  are big fans of and always in search of the perfect brunch...and this just didn't make the cut.Upon entering, we were seated in a somewhat transitional area between the front room where the bar is and the back room, where they were having some sort of bridal/baby shower. The kitchen was adjacent to us, so there was adequate waitstaff continuously passing by.  Despite the fact that other than the shower (that hadn't yet started...just a few girls there early for the party decorating and setting doodads up for the bride to be/expectant mother) the service was nothing to write home about.  The Maitre d' seemed way too concerned with the poor girls scotch taping things to the wall in the next room over for their party.  I should not have had to hear this ranting and raving when he could have asked them politely and professionally to please not hang anything o the walls...Instead he bitched and whined about it right in front of us, outside of the kitchen for a good 10 minutes or so, and then snottily (is that a word) and rudely asked that they remove everything, while he, himself started ripping things angrily off of the wall while muttering under his breath about the new paint job being ruined.  Exaggerate much?  It was scotch tape-not liquid nails.He then proceeded to bring part of our table the incorrect order....with so few people here at this time, this seemed kind of ridiculous that the order was wrong.  We ate so that our food didn't get cold, while my Aunt politely sat waiting for her correct order.  When we all had our correct meals, they were tasty, but nothing extraordinary.I would check it out one more time and give it another chance, perhaps for dinner when there weren't showers going on all around us, and we didn't have a maitr d' that was too wrapped up in a....sticky situation.

I want to love Amanda's... I really do.  But for some reason I can't.  The food is good - but I can't say I've been wow'ed by the cuisine, though - and I expect that in a place like this.  A place where the decor is "old" but perfectly classic and the service is second to none.And the service is great, by the way.  They really do treat you well and I've always had a great experience with the wait staff - going as far as ordering me a town car after diner.  They've been patient with me as a party of 2 or 6 and I've always been treated with respect.I just can't get used to the rather common menu items and similarly common taste.If you are looking to impress someone from the area, be completely taken care of, want to see the "rich and powerful" of Hoboken, and don't mind good (not great) food, I would say give Amanda's a try.  If you are looking for really great food, you might want to go elsewhere.
I've been meaning to get around to rating this place for quite some time now.  I brought my mother here last year and we both enjoyed the experience.

We love Amanda's! The food is fabulous and it's not ridiculously overpriced like some of our friends across the river. The ambiance is great, it almost feels like your coming home to mom's for dinner...so cozy and clean. I even bought the replica picture of old Yankee stadium in the men's bathroom! Can't wait to go back. One of the better spots in Hoboken!

I had dinner here with my boyfriend and a friend who was visiting from out of town on a Thursday night. We went for the special where you had to order before 5:45 pm.  On the website it said 5:45 pm but the waitress told us 6:00 pm which helped since we got there at around 5:45 pm.  I ordered the soup of the day, chicken with wild rice and chocolate mousse.  My friend ordered the salad, steak and key lime pie.  Everything was delicious.  I love bread but it has to be perfect.  Their bread was delicious.  I asked for seconds on the bread since they don't bring a bread basket to the table.  The bread was freshly baked and served hot.  The service was excellent.  Our food didn't take long to come out either.  The regular menu is a little pricey. I'm glad they offered the discounted menu of $32 per couple or $16 per person.  The next time I'm in Hoboken, I would definitely go back and maybe try the food on their regular menu.

Every time I pass Amanda's I say to myself "I have to try this place" but it never goes further than that. I finally made reservations this past Saturday and I was definitely pleased. Ate in the Library which was small but in a cozy way. For appetizer we ordered the Fig and Caramelized Onion Bruschetta with Blue Cheese and Red Wine Syrup. Loved this app, the blue cheese and figs hit the palette very nicely especially with the bottle of Pinot Noir that we ordered. The entrees were both absolutely YUMMYLICIOUS!! Pork Chop Stuffed with Apple, Pancetta and Dubliner Cheddar with Sweet Potato Mash and Brussels Spicy Seafood Stew with Mussels, Clams, Shrimp and Fish in a Light Tomato Broth Overall, great ambiance and definitely a good place to take a date. Service was very good. The water glasses never had a chance to get low, something greatly appreciated haven eaten at restaurants where you have to actually choke before they come to replenish. Bill was about $110, pretty reasonable in my book for the quality of the food and service provided. I have to go back for sure to try the Brunch which everyone seems to be raving about. I'll reserve my fifth star for then ;) I definitely recommend this place!

What a great restaurant! Really friendly service and very nice atmosphere. Great food overall, though I have to highlight their seafood stew: outstanding! Filled with salmon, and also clams, etc. love the place

Amanda's Restaurant is a great, classy brunch spot and the food is absolutely amazing! I took my aunt for brunch and it was perfect. She had the Croissant French Toast with Seasonal Fruit Compote which was super light, sweet, and delicious. I had the Crispy Eggs with Asparagus, Shiitake Mushrooms, Prosciutto and Parmesan Fonduta, which was very different from her choice, but equally as delicious . And of course, the mimosas were the perfect touch! The decor and atmosphere is a bit old-fashioned and the tiniest bit stuffy, I wouldn't call it romantic or trendy. Not the best place for a loud, boozy brunch with friends, but the food is simply incredible.

Solid 4-starer.Great lighting, the dining rooms are broken up so that its not too noisy, the cute mismatching but elegant plates are a nice touch.All the food we got was excellent (polenta & honey-balsamic chicken) and the glass of prosecco was very generous.  We finished with the molten chocolate cake (as usual...) which was very good.Only complaint - the service was very pleasant but suuuppeerr slow.  The food made up for it though.And last - one of the cleanest, brightest bathrooms i've ever seen in a restaurant!!

I've had dinner here twice.  The first time I had a duck entree that was delicious.  Cooked perfectly.  The second time I went with three friends of mine and had sirlion.  I eat steak quite often and am very particular about my steaks being cooked to the proper temp (in my case rare) the steak was wonderfully cooked and delicious.  I also like the fact that the menu changes relatively frequently.  All in all I would certainly go back and recommend to friends.

Amanda's is by far the best restaurant in Hoboken. We've been there twice and each time we've had impeccable service to go along with an amazing meal.  Each course is just fantastic, and make sure to leave room for dessert.  The menu changes seasonally which makes returning even better.  The decor is beautiful and inviting. It is also a great place for a date.

Delicious, inexpensive brunch in the cutest of settings. Its a comfy, classy old house, with several rooms for dining and a nice wooden bar in the front room. Poached eggs and crab hash, eggs benedict, croissant french toast, balthazar bread basket...all delicious. Definitely interested in some of the "lunch" options for net time. Classy, comfortable, great service and tasty food.

This place has a reputation that it is one of the best retaurants in Hoboken, NJ. I would concur that this reputation is lived up to. Many people think it is expensive, but I was surprised that it isn't really all that expensive. The food is not crazily out-of-this-world good, but it is consistently good. It is very busy, and reservations are definitely needed. Service is good and the wine list is excellent with some great buys for certain wines on their menu.

Went here for an early dinner on my 30th with my fiance. Great food, great service. Loved the cute bar when you first walk in. Very old-timey atmosphere, lots of really great old jazzy music, I was in heaven. As for the price, I didn't have to pay, but it I know it was up there... Definitely a place to go for a special romantic occasion.

Charming place in a quaint brownstone, serving delectable croissant french toast (why didn't I think of that!), frittata with mozzarella, tomatoes, and eggplant, and the best and non-greasiest breakfast potatoes!

I almost hesitate to give such a glowing review for fear of drawing even more people here, but I have to give Amanda's their due because the food and service is consistently excellent and they also happen to have prob the best value dinner in the tri-state area. We have been here for both brunch and the 'Early Dinner'.  The brunch is top notch...can't do eggs benedict any better and the poached egg with crab hash and orange hollandaise is incredible.  I could drink the hollandaise straight.  The drinks/mimosas are also good and super reasonable at $7/8 per.  On to the 'Early Dinner'...it's called this because you have to have your order in by 6pm Mon-Sat to get the deal and what a deal it is!  Three course prix-fixe menu for $16 per person.  Yes, that's right dinner for two for $32.  You only get a choice of three or four starters, entrees and desserts, but they're all very good and excellent value. And you can also get a bottle of the house featured wine, red or white, for $20.  So you can have a very good 3 course meal and bottle of wine for about $60 for two including tip.  This is practically unheard of within a 50 mile radius of Manhattan.  If you live in Hoboken and haven't taken advantage of this place you should have your head examined.

I came here on Valentine's Day so I didn't have any breakfast foods. The staff was very welcoming, but my waitress seriously seemed upset that she was working on Valentine's Day. The lobster bisque did not have big chunks of lobster in it...disappointing. The beef filet was really good, but their mashed potatoes were not so good. I had the sorbet for dessert which featured rose petal sorbet--I thought it was lemon. Bad surprise.
I took my girlfriend here for New Year's and food was amazing! She got the lobster bisque, and I would definitely recommend it. Seating was a little tight, but what restaurant isn't.

i've come here for dinner a time or two (YUMMY!!!) but never really thought to come for weekend brunch - so happy i did, though! brunch is served both saturday & sunday, which is great. there is plenty to choose from on the menu - i got the fritatta (highly recommended) and my +1 got the french toast. both of us didn't stop raving about our meals for the rest of the day. fairly priced, too. and the service is great. overall, i will absolutely remember (and recommend!) this spot for weekend brunch!

We were here for a rehearsal dinner last Friday, which was probably ill-advised because they are a truly tiny spot and it just wasn't fitting 60 of us so well, but the food and atmosphere were awesome and I hope to go back for that Saturday night dinner soon. Even better was seeing how cute Hoboken is now. When did that happen?

Amandas does have the best deal in Hoboken for a great dinner - Prix FIxe of 28 bucks for a couple - 5 and 530 PM seatings. Even Saturdays.The service is almost too  good - they have people whirling all over filling water, bringing out food. Its almost too much action.The food is great, the Sweet Potato soup is so good we tried to make it at home, with some success.Just a great place to take out of towners if youre trying to have a fine meal on the cheap, or for a cheap date.

Great brunch spot in Hoboken.  Lovely mismatched china set a great tone before you start the meal, the service was perfectly timed and the waiter was completely on top of our order, even with a big party.  The best part was that the food was simply divine. From the french toast with blueberries to crispy bacon that I had to the egg dishes my friends tried, everything came out wonderfully & on time.  I would certainly go back.

Amanda's is universally regarded as the finest restaurant in Hoboken. The charming colonial townhouse setting is enchanting and uber-romantic with seating divided among several dining rooms. The restaurant's winning trompe l'oeil décor and its menu full of tempting choices attracts the well-heeled young professionals who inhabit the neighborhood. They have what is possibly THE BEST deal in all of the Tri-State area, an early three course dinner for two for the total price of $28 ($14 per person). The kitchen is run by CIA trained Rodney Peterson. His irresistible dishes include sweet black mussels bathed in a lightly pungent garlic and white wine broth speckled with parsley; and creamy polenta punctuated with an herbed tomato sauce made rich with mascarpone, fontina and mozzarella cheeses. Salads are complex and artfully presented. The kitchen demonstrates a sure hand with fish, and it rightfully dominates the menu. The sauteed grouper with basmati rice is perfectly cooked. Game dishes, seasonally on the menu, offer rich flavors, as illustrated with the tender seared grilled venison. A sophisticated wine list is offered at reasonable prices. Desserts are something of an afterthought, but a good choice is Rodney's Cheesecake, light-bodied and just right. The apple-raisin strudel sends you to a cozy chalet in the Austrian Alps.

I have been to Amanda's for brunch before, but that was many years ago.  My most recent trip to Amanda's was last week for dinner.  It just so happened that it was also Hudson Restaurant Week and they were offering a three-course fix prixe menu for $35.  We chose to order off the regular menu, but everything on both menus looked delicious.  I had a smoked trout and endive salad for an appetizer and fish stew for an entree.  Both were excellent!  The stew had an assortment of mussels, clams, shrimp, salmon and halibut.  The meal was truly wonderful!

This review is long overdue because we came here for my birthday dinner a little over a month ago. It was AMAZING. From start to finish, the experience exceed every expectation. Our waiter was attentive but not overbearing and made great recommendations. We started off with the gnocchi carbonara, which was melt in your mouth good. For entrees, we had the salmon and jumbo shrimp. For dessert, we had their homemade cheesecake and they topped it off by writing happy birthday in chocolate around the plate. The food was phenomenal and it really was one of the best birthday dinners I've ever had.

Amanda is one of must visit restaurants in Hoboken.  The decoration is very classic and the service is always very present.  The recent visit is a casual dinner with good friends of ours during one of week night.  The wine selection is interesting: from Austria to South Africa.  (But not France)  The prefix menu is delicious but I can not by pass the Duck which is always the best.  Deserts are up to expectation..

Best restaurant in town, by far! The experience is like going to the city for dinner. Everything is carefully presented, served and delicious. I can't wait to go back again! They do have a great prix fix menu

Had high hopes for this place.  Went for dinner this past Friday.  Lived in town for many years and have never been.  Review are great so expected something exceptional.  Very underwhelming.  Decor is awful and stuffy.  They could use a face lift and get with the times a bit.  The food was nothing to write home about and for the price, you are better off going out somewhere cool in the city.  Overall OK.  Won't be rushing back anytime soon.

We dined on Friday night, making a reservation for 5 of us at 8 p.m.  Our table was ready on time and was a nice large round in a corner with a view through french doors of a garden area.  We had all had fairly late lunches so didn't try any appetizers.  I had the beet and endive salad and it was delicious. One of our party enjoyed the bisque very much.  All five of us had different entrees:  a pasta dish, the trout, the pork chop, seared scallops and myself the seafood stew.  Given a choice at a really nice restaurant I generally will try the cioppino or seafood stew.  I just loved it.  The mussels and clams were tender as can be, the fish was not dry and the shrimp were succulent.  I thought the broth was very flavorful.   And broth is all that was left when I finished.  My wife's scallops were perfectly done and very flavorful without being at all oily.  And there were raves from the other three about their entrees as well.  The others shared a couple of delicious looking desserts while I had a nice 20 year old tawny port that finished things off nicely.  The prices are quite reasonable for the quality and the wine list was broad without being interminably long.  We had a couple of bottles of wine, one red, one white.   I think we were all in, including tax and tip for under $400 for five people but we divided the check and I was getting a little fuzzy by then, so that might be off a little..  By the way, the service was up to the quality of the food, quite excellent.

I brought my wife here for her birthday and I've got to say I was very impressed.  The wine list was amazing, and we ended ordering a nice Cab.  We then ordered a couple of appetizers, both of which were excellent.  For our main course, I had a stuffed pork chop which was cooked to perfection and my wife ordered a Cod dish which was on special on also fantastic.  What was extra special was that the waitress brought us a complimentary piece of cheesecake for my wife's birthday and it was just because our waitress overheard me saying happy bday.  Very nice touch.  I would strongly recommend trying Amanda's.  I've also heard they have an amazing weekend brunch which I also plan to try.

I was excited to go here as according to some this is the top rated restaurant in Hoboken. It is not however the best. It has all the trappings of a fine dining establishment and yet it doesn't work. Maybe it's the mish-mash of styles from faux Maxfield Parish to Art Nouvelle to faux Baroque. Or perhaps it's the battery powered flicker candle lights on the tables, but the over all impression is  "Dinner at Grandma's house."  You know those family dinners we all had to endure where everyone is trying really hard to be amiable, and not break anything, or be the one to cause scandal, so it all has a cozy quilted prison feeling that won't go away even after years of therapy. Yeah, you know what I mean, and that glass of wine you're reaching for isn't going to change a damn thing... but I digress.The service while a tad pinched is excellent. And the food while not incredible is very good. I had the bacon wrapped monk fish and was blissfully engrossed (and is the only reason I'm giving three stars}. But I found our appetizers {the mussels and the goat cheese salad} rather dull. And we didn't feel inclined to stick around for dessert.Over all not a bad place to take your Grandmother ... assuming she's dead.

Ugh if this place was any more pretentious i think i might come out of my shoes. We came for the price fixe dinner. I understand they want to cater more to the upscale crowd, but if they put as much focus into the food i think this place could afford to ease up on the show they put on. When i go to a restaurant i like to feel welcome and this place just came off as cold. Like if i sneezed i would be thrown out of the place.
If Eugene and Doug are still running Amanda's it is a 5 star restaurant.

I've been here a handful of times with family and friends and the food is always amazing and everyone we bring here loves it too.  Dinner can get a little pricey but it is well worth it and you can save a lot if you do the early dinner special at 5:15 if you can get a table.  Great place for a romantic dinner too.  If you're a foodie, like my husband and I are, it definitely beats the typical bar and bistro fare.  If they ever have polenta on the menu, you must get it. It's incredibly smooth, cheesy and rich...by far the best polenta I've had. So, if you can plan ahead for dinner reservations, this is the place to go! Cheers and happy dining!

We went here for a late brunch. It was good for what it's worth. Nothing much going on. Small place and a simple menu but nothing that would make me anxious to come back for more. If you're in the area, it's an option. Then again, my vote will always be 5 Guys. :)

Went here with my bf for brunch. The food and the service were both very good.  We had eggs with potatoes, both very good esp the potatoes. And I ordered a side of bacon. It was just the way I love it, cripsy. We ordered drinks too, both pretty good. I would def go back and try the dinner menu. Only thing was parking was tough but that was due to the Arts & Music Festival going on today. But hey it was a nice day out so it was good to enjoy the walking and got to check out the street fair.

My mom and I were lucky enough to walk in to Amanda's today without a reservation. I was so pleased with the atmosphere and the food was delicious! I had the turkey club sandwich. I was expecting a standard club, especially for the price ($8), but was surprised with an excellently crafted sandwich that made my taste buds very happy! Such an array of flavors! Very happy with the experience!

Had the early dinner special last Tuesday.  Food was delicious yet unpretentious, same for atmosphere. Service effortlessly professional.  Unbeatable value at 15 per person, house wine (the cab was head and shoulders about most house wines) $20.  Portion sizes were perfect so that the 3 courses was quite filling but not too.
This is my favorite restaurant in Hoboken. My husband and I go here every special occasion and it never disappoints!

Unbelievable brunch on the weekends! We went here for a birthday brunch and it was delicious. They have  a nice little room you can rent for showers or parties. I would like to come back and try it for dinner some time. This would be the perfect place to take mom for mother's day brunch, but get a reservation, I have a feeling the mom's day reservations are all booked by April!
I loved this place!  The space is warm, friendly and charming. Excellent service and wonderful food.  Really good wine list too.

Had one of the WORST dining experiences of our lives here.  Got to restaurant, not crowded at all, but seated right next to large (14 people, boisterous!) party.  Asked if anything else was available, told nothing in "main rooms" (although I'd made reservation more than a week in advance) but they could put us in small room at back.  Did not know this meant having to walk through semi-private room where this party was taking place.  It was HORRIBLE, Loud, plus tiny table for four, mold on wall, and service was insanely bad.  We have been here for brunch many times, but never again for dinner.  Food was sub-par.  I honestly think this restaurant is relying on its past history, time to update, become more contemporary.  OH, when 20 minutes after being seated I went to rest room, most of the rest of the restaurant was DESERTED.  So, liars as well.  There are now SO many far better restaurants in Hoboken, and ones that care about your business.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Solidly executed bistro-American fare, in a very nice space (indoor and out).

Great for champagne brunch. The food is really great and I loved the atmosphere. I noticed that a few rooms had events in them and everyone seemed well attended to and very happy. Even with those huge parties going on our table was very very well taken care of. Great service, good food, nice atmosphere.

If you want a classic place for a romantic date, try this hidden gem. It isn't really hidden but surprisingly few people know about it and the food is wonderful. At times a little heavy on the salt but if you just ask them to go light on the salt it's done exactly the way you'd like it. The atmosphere is perfect for a winter or fall evening for drinks with friends at the bar. The bartender is friendly and cool. The waitstaff is courteous, considerate and pleasant. I've enjoyed the waitresses coming over to chat about a good wine or a tasty after dinner drink. Their recommendations are always on the spot. I love a place where the waitstaff eats the food. You have to wonder about a place that doesn't give their people an idea of what is being served. Save room for dessert because the dessert wine pairing is fantastic with their molten chocolate cake. Take your old friends or a date, it's a place that should not be missed if you stop by Hoboken for food. It's wonderful and you will enjoy the experience.
This place is great!  The stir-fry was recommended to me...and it wouldn't normally have been my choice but it was delicious, and presented in a very unique way.  Very cute date place.  High recos!
